Sonia is 25-year-old woman who is a responsible mother with two daughters. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan, and her husband works as a rickshaw driver. For a number of days, her husband's rickshaw has not been working properly and he is therefore unable to generate any amount of income. Sonia's husband is addicted to drugs and unable to earn properly as he wastes half of his income on drugs. Sonia's family is going through a difficult financial time. 

Sonia is requesting a loan from the Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw as soon as possible. She wants her husband to continue his work, but they have been unable to fund repairs. Sonia is very thankful to Kiva.

loans.use: to help her husband cover the cost of repairing his rickshaw

loans.name: Erdenebold

texts.en:
Erdenebold is 31 years old and lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on plot of land. For the past seven years, Erdenebold has been providing taxi service to local people. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers and driving them quickly to their destination by the shortest route. His wife recently gave birth to their second son and has taken maternity leave. 

Erdenebold is requesting a 4,000,000 MNT loan to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and furniture such as a sofa, television, and dresser. As a result of his loan, Erdenebold's house will be a comfortable and warm place which will enable his family to burn less coal, emit less smoke, and contribute to efforts against air pollution. Erdenebold is a very hardworking individual who strives for better future.

loans.use: to purchase vacuum-insulated windows and furniture for his house

loans.name: Cirila

texts.es:
Cirila de 42 años de edad , esta casada y tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa construida a base de adobe.Cirila se dedica a la venta de productos comestibles desde hace 3 años porque dejo de lado su anterior trabajo en el campo junto a su esposo donde cosechaba cacao orgánico.Habilitó un ambiente con vista a la calle de su vivienda y con capital que acumuló gracias a su anterior actividad adquirió poca mercadería a manera de prueba.Con el paso de los meses logró obtener buenas ganancias porque no tenía competencia  en su localidad siendo motivo para adquirir mayor mercadería en sus próximas compras.Gracias a las ganancias a logrado solventar los estudios de su hijo mayor quien ingreso a la universidad siendo este el motivo para seguir trabajando.Ofrece  a su distinguida clientela productos de primera necesidad como víveres, enlatados, y bebidas heladas los cuales tienen  buena demanda por vivir en una zona tropical.
Suele adquirir mercadería al por mayor de productos no perecibles logrando obtener mejores ganancias y asegurar el abastecimiento de su negocio por mayor tiempo.
Es una labor muy abnegada ya que puede estar en casa sin descuidar el cuidado de sus hijos menores mientras su esposo continúa aportando a la economía familiar desde el campo.Desea con el tiempo ampliar su negocio y apoyar los estudios superiores de sus demás hijos por  considerar la educación de su familia como la mejor inversión de la vida.Este su primer préstamo otorgado por Kiva y se siente muy agradecida por el financiamiento brindado.Desea en esta ocasión contar con 1,000 nuevos soles para adquirir sacos de arroz y azúcar esperando abastecer su negocio con estos productos los cuales son muy consumidos.
texts.en:
Cirila is 42 years old, married and has three children.  They all live together in an adobe house.  Cirilia sells food products and had been doing so for three years, when she stopped working in the fields with her husband, where they raised organic cacao.  Since she had an area with a view of the street, and money saved up from her previous work, she bought a little bit of merchandise to give it a try.  Over the next few months she was able to obtain good earnings because she didn’t have any competition in the area, which was the reason for her to acquire more merchandise on her next purchase.  Thanks to her earnings, she has been able to pay for her children’s university education, giving her reason to keep working.  She sells primary needs products such as canned goods, and cold drinks of which she has great demand due to living in a tropical climate. 

She wants to get more non-perishable items to increase her earnings and supply. Her business for a longer time.

This is a very selfless job because she can stay at home and not neglect caring for her children while her husband continues supporting the family financially from the fields.  She eventually wants to expand her business and support her children’s education as a lifetime investment.  This will be her first loan through Kiva and she is grateful.  She is asking for 1,000 PEN in order to buy sacks of rice and sugar to supply her business with these high demand products.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is married and runs a business selling dried fish in the Philippines. She has operated her business for the past ten years and works hard to support her family. 

Lanie is requesting a 19,500 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of dried fish to sell. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish to sell

loans.name: Mauricio Francisco

texts.es: Mauricio Francisco de 67 años de edad, casado, con dos hijos, uno menor de edad que asiste a la educación secundaria, y el otro que le ayuda en la vivienda. Hace varios años empezó vendiendo golosinas en su casa de habitación y actualmente es propietario de una pulpería, donde ofrece diferentes productos básicos, para el consumo del hogar, las compras las realiza a través de camiones repartidores o distribuidores que lo visitan en su negocio, estas las hace al contado y vende de contado y también al crédito. Su familia y èl dependen de sus ingresos que genera el negocio. Don Mauricio es un hombre que demuestra ser esforzado, luchador y con muchos deseos de superación, para salir adelante con su familia, él solicita un préstamo, para capital de trabajo, ya que desea invertir más en su negocio y así abastecerlo más en cantidad de productos y en productos demandados por sus clientes. Don Mauricio se encuentra muy agradecido con la oportunidad que le ha brindado  los inversionistas Kivas y la atención que se le da en el proceso del crédito.
texts.en:
Mauricio Francisco, 67, is married and has two children; one is a minor who attends secondary education, and the other helps him in the house. 

Several years ago he began selling sweets in his house and now he owns a convenient store, where he offers different basic products for household consumption. He makes his purchases from delivery trucks and distributors who visit him at his business.  He pays cash for the goods and accepts cash or credit when selling the goods to his customers. He and his family depend on his income that the business generates. 

Mauricio is a man who is diligent, determined and with hope to improve, to get his family ahead. He is requesting a loan, for working capital, since he wishes to invest more in his business and thus have more supplies and products demanded by his customers. 

Mauricio is very grateful for the opportunity that Kiva lenders have offered him and the attention that he is given in the loan process.

loans.use: to get working capital to expand his business and satisfy his customers' needs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase pants, skirts, t-shirts, blouses, sandals, boxers, swimsuits, and other items for her business.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be determined . She operates a green grocery store where she sells cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with regular customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be high transport fees. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to add stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables. She hopes that in the future she will achieve her targets. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loans were paid successfully.

loans.use: to add stock of cabbages, tomatoes, onions and other vegetables

loans.name: Lanie

texts.en:
Lanie is 52 years old and widowed.  She has five children, one of whom is in school. Lanie works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase food and household goods to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.  Lanie has been in this business for one year.

In the future Lanie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase food and household goods to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Shumaila

texts.en:
Shumaila is a 41 year-old woman. She is a responsible, hard working and kind woman and lives in Lahore, Pakistan with her family.  She has excellent embroidery skills. Her husband's income is inadequate to cover the household expenses. Therefore, Shumaila has been running a small home-based embroidery business so that she can help her husband to generate some amount of income to cover the family needs. 

Shumaila has requested a loan amount of 25,000pkr from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase embroidery material for the shop, including threads, cloth, needles, colorful stones and buttons. She wants to save a sufficient amount of income for her children's education. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase embroidery material for her busniess.

loans.name: Juan Manuel

texts.es:
Juan Manuel, de 46 años de edad, trabajó por varios años en una empresa del sector comercial, pero debido a un recorte de personal, quedó desempleado, suceso que lo motivó a motar su propio negocio y convertirse en un microempresario. 
Desde hace tres meses abrió al público una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar, la cual ha tenido muy buena acogida entre las personas del sector, motivo que lo ha impulsado solicitar un crédito dedicado a la compra de surtido y compra de estanterías para mejorar la exhibición de los productos. Espera seguir solventando las necesidades de hogar y la educación de su hijo de 16 años.
texts.en:
Juan Manuel is 46 years old.  He worked for many years for a business in the commercial sector, but due to downsizing, he became unemployed.  This motivated him to start his own business and become an entrepreneur.  

He opened a general store to the public three months ago.  The business has been well received by the people in his neighborhood, which caused him to request a loan so that he can purchase stock and shelves so that he can better present his products.  He hopes that he can meet the needs of his household and educate his 16 year old son.

loans.use: to purchase shelves to improve the presentation of his products.

loans.name: Alfred

texts.en:
Alfred, aged 30 years, is a single man who lives at his own house that has neither electricity nor piped water.  For two years, he has operated a clothes selling business, selling at the market to his neighbors and passersby. He faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. He dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business in the future. 

With the loan that he is requesting, he wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian works hard to support her family. Lilian is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of food to sell.  Lilian has been in this business for 6 years now.

In the future, Lilian would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of food to sell

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 26 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. For the past four years, she has been buying and selling cultured pearls in the Philippines. Liza is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Liza is requesting an 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of cultured pearl to sell. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Luz Estella

texts.es:
Luz Stella de 50 años de edad, se ha ganado el aprecio de su comunidad. Su disciplina y esfuerzo le ha permitido cumplir con su gran sueño de crear su propio taller. 
Dedicada a la confección desde hace 20 años, esta mujer ha logrado salir adelante con sus tres hijos. Su experiencia, la ha abierto grandes puertas en el sector comercial. 
Labora desde su casa en confección a terceros, lo que le permite compartir más tiempo en familia y realizar las labores del hogar. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de  telas e hilos, con el fin de cumplir con los pedidos solicitados.
Su mayor sueño es poder ampliar su negocio lo que le permitirá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
50-year-old Luz Stella has won the respect of her community. Her discipline and effort has allowed her to achieve her greatest dream of establishing her own workshop. Tailoring for 20 years, this women has managed to get ahead with her three children. Her experience has opened big doors for her in the commercial sector.

Luz works from home doing outsourced work, which lets her spend more time with her family and do housework. Currently she is requesting a loan that she will invest in the purchase of fabric and thread so that she can complete the orders placed. 

Her biggest dream to is to be able to enlarge her business, which will allow her to improve her family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase fabric and thread.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fruit to make juice

loans.name: Luis Ángel

texts.es:
Luis ángel de 67 años de edad, es un campesino dedicado a las labores agropecuarias. Amante al campo, flora y fauna de su región. Se dedica principalmente a la producción de leche como actividad generadora de ingresos para su núcleo familiar, En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de una vaca con el fin de aumentar su producción lechera y aumentar sus ingresos. 
Su mayor sueño es salir adelante y garantizarle a su  familia  mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
67-year-old Luis Angel is a farmer who does agricultural work. He is a lover of the countryside, and of the flora and fauna of his region. Luis mainly produces milk to generate income for his family. Currently he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of a cow in order to increase his milk production and income. 

Luis's dream is to get ahead and guarantee his family the best living conditions.

loans.use: purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is married and works hard to support her family. For the past three years, she has run a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

Luzviminda is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to maintain her motorcycle

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
La señora María  de  60  años de edad, es madre soltera, no tiene  hijos  que dependen de ella, vive en la comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras.
Doña María  tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 05 años  a la venta de abarrotería, frescos y verduras también vende carnes.
Doña María es una persona que trabaja fuerte y desea sacar adelante a su familia sus ventas las realiza de lunes a domingo y sus clientes son los amigos y personas que a diario le visitan.
Doña María  está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de frescos, leche, quesos, huevos, agua, arroz, frijoles, azúcar, pan, galletas, etc. con el apoyo del crédito espera que  mejore un poco sus ingresos y su negocio.
Doña María espera de  esta forma poder suplir su necesidad de financiamiento, está muy contenta de seguir trabajando con Prisma, su sueño es mejorar su negocio.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Abril del 2013
texts.en:
María, 60, is a single mother; she doesn't have any dependent children. She lives in the community of San Lorenzo, the valley south of Honduras. María has her own house and for 5 years she has been selling groceries, soft drinks, vegetables and meat.

Maria is a person who works very hard and wishes to get her family ahead. Her works from Monday to Sunday and her customers are friends and people who she visits daily.

Maria is requesting a loan for the purchase of soft drinks, milk, cheese, eggs, water, rice, beans, sugar, bread, cakes, etc... With the loan, she hopes it will improve her income and her business a little.

María hopes that this way she can meet her financial needs. She is very happy to continue working with Prism and her dream is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - April 2013

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, milk, cheese, eggs, water, rice, beans, sugar, bread, cakes, etc... for her business.

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: La Sra. Benita tiene 49 años y cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas de temporada, en esta época se encuentra vendiendo plátano, pero ya llega la cosecha de mangos y duraznos, fruta que compra directo del productor, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de un puesto de venta en el mercado cerca de su casa ya que ella vende en un puesto que es alquilado, la Sra. Benita es una cliente responsable, cliente antigua de la institución, La Sra. Benita enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia su  sueño para su negocio es tener un puesto bien surtido con frutas de la temporada y crecer en su negocio para así generar más ingresos.
texts.en:
Benita is 49 years old and has four children. She works selling seasonal fruits. Right now she is selling bananas, but the mango and peach harvests will soon arrive. She buys the fruit directly from producers. 

On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy a vendor stall at the market near her house because she sells from a rented stall. 

Benita has been a client of the institution for many years and is responsible. In her business she faces the challenge of overcoming poverty. She will use her profits to improve her family's quality of living. 

Her dream for her business is to have a stall that is stocked with a good assortment of seasonal fruits. She hopes her business will grow so she can generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy a vendor stall.

loans.name: Víctor Alexander

texts.es:
Víctor tiene 23 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Desde hace seis años trabaja como panadero; antes trabajaba como ayudante de albañilería.  Su trabajo consiste en vender pan, a él le asignan un monto para vender y tiene que completar esa cantidad; lo que hace es que transporta en su motocicleta a diferentes lugares para venderlo todo.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación  Campo, es para reparar la motocicleta, que es el medio que utiliza para vender todo el pan. Él recorre treinta minutos desde su lugar de trabajo hasta un pueblo y desde ahí sale a otros lugares. Reparar su motocicleta es muy importante ya que sin ella no puede realizar su trabajo y no tendría disponible el dinero para los gastos del hogar. Su propósito, es comprar ropa deportiva para que su esposa la venda en el mercado municipal y sea ella quien la administre y poder obtener otra fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Victor is 23 years old, married, and has one son.  He has worked as a baker for the past six years; previously, he worked as an assistant bricklayer.  His job is selling bread.  He is allocated an amount to sell and must meet that quota.  He transports the bread by motorcycle to various locations where he sells it all.  

The loan that he is requesting from Fundación Campo is to repair the motorcycle, the means he uses to sell all the bread.  He travels thirty minutes from his place of business to town and from there, he goes to other locations.  Repairing his motorcycle is very important because he cannot do his job without it and consequently, he will not have money available to pay his household expenses.  His goal is to purchase sportswear for his wife to sell in the town market.  She will manage the business and this will provide another source of income.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle.

loans.name: Salome

texts.en:
Salome, a 41-year-old married mother of two children aged 6 and 19 years, operates a green grocery store where she sells tomatoes, potatoes, cabbages and other vegetables. Located in an area with regular local customers, her business has been operating for four years. She describes her biggest challenge as insufficient capital.

Salome will use this Kes 5000 loan, her first with SMEP DTM, to buy more cabbages to sell. Her business goal is to have a shop within five years.

loans.use: to buy more cabbages for sell

loans.name: Raul Antonio

texts.es: Don Raul de 52 años de edad, vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos y su compañera de vida, El posee una tienda donde vende pan, refrescos, aceites, golosinas y también de primera necesidad como: jabón y shampoo entre otras cosas tiene su negocio en su casa de habitación desde hace 16 años. Raul solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir aún más la tienda con golosinas, garnos basicos, aceites, etc. de manera que pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y de esta misma forma mejorar sus ventas lo cual es su prioridad para sacar adelante su hogar y a su familia.
texts.en:
52-year-old Don Raul lives in his own house with his children and his life partner. He owns a store that sells bread, sodas, cooking oil, candies and staple items such as soap and shampoo among other things. His business has been in his home for 16 years. 

Raul is requesting a loan through which he can stock his store with even more candies, staple grains, cooking oils, etc. so that he can better serve his clients and in the same way improve his sales, which is his priority for getting his home and his family ahead.

loans.use: purchase staple grains, cooking oil, candies, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel de 54 años de edad, se caracteriza por ser un hombre emprendedor y visionario. Decidió abrirse camino y montar su propio negocio, con el fin de manejar su tiempo y compartir con su familia.  Abrió una tienda dedicada a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar y poder generar el sustento para él y su familia.
Agradece la oportunidad que Dios le ha dado de convertirse en un micro empresario. Su mayor deseo es ofrecer un servicio de calidad y mejorar la condición económica de su casa. Razón por la cual, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido, aumentando la variedad de productos y  el nivel de ventas.
texts.en:
Manuel is 54 years old. He is known as an enterprising and visionary man. He decided to strike out on his own and open his own business with the goal of setting his own schedule and spending time with his family. He opened a shop selling everyday household staples in order to be able to provide for himself and his family.

He is grateful for the opportunity that God has given him to become a small businessman. His greatest wish is to offer a quality service and improve the financial situation of his household. That's why he is now requesting a loan for the purchase of stock to increase his variety of products and his sales.

loans.use: to purchase everyday household staples.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is 25 years old and has two children. She and her husband are farmers and currently live in a rural community where they support their family by cultivating farm lots and planting corn and vegetables to sell.  

Bernadeth is requesting a 21,000 PHP loan from Kiva lenders through ASKI to purchase seed, fertilizer, and herbicide, and to pay labor costs to prepare their land. She plans to use her loan to expand her vegetable production to ensure a good harvest.  Bernadeth hopes her loan will be granted to help her family expand their vegetable production and improve their income.

loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer, and herbicide, and pay labor costs to prepare land

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 53 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. For the past ten years, she has run a fish-selling business in the Philippines. Lydia is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Lydia is requesting a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a machine to bend metal.

loans.name: Sergio

texts.es:
Sergio de 41 años de edad, es un hombre emprendedor, que se ha ganado la admiración de su familia y vecinos. Desde hace tres años decidió emprender su propio negocio dedicado a los videojuegos, con el fin de mejorar la calidad de su familia y garantizarles educación a sus dos hijos.
Hoy se siente satisfecho por los logros alcanzados y asegura que su mayor deseo es que su negocio siga creciendo con el propósito de mejorar la calidad de vida en su núcleo familiar, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de un T.V y una consola play station, lo que le permitirá prestar un mejor servicio y mejorar su condición económica.
texts.en:
Sergio, age 41, is an enterprising man who has earned the admiration of his family and neighbours. Three years ago he decided to start his own video game business with the goal of improving his family's quality of life and guaranteeing his children an education.
These days, he feels very satisfied with his achievements and assures us that his greatest desire is for his business to keep growing with the goal of improving the quality of life of his nuclear family. For this reason, he is requesting a loan which he will invest in the purchase of a TV and a Play Station console. This will allow him to offer a better service and improve his economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy a TV and a Play Station console.

loans.name: Marlene Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlene, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la facilidad que brinda la institución para poder cancelar. Este le permitirá comprar maíz, gas, aceite, arroz, entre otros productos para la venta de pupusas.
El crédito anterior le permitió generar mayores ventas porque contaba con  la materia prima para realizar la venta. Las circunstancias familiares han mejorado porque los ingresos han incrementado; asimismo las condiciones economicas.
texts.en:
Marlene is requesting a new loan because the institution makes it so easy to repay loans. This loan will allow her to purchase corn, fuel, oil, rice, and other products for the sale of pupusas [a thick corn tortilla stuffed with cheese, fried pork rind, chicken, or refried beans].
Her previous loan allowed her to achieve higher sales because she had the base materials for making sales. Her family's circumstances have improved because her income has increased; their economic conditions have improved as well.

loans.use: to buy corn, fuel, oil, rice, and other products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime nació en la ciudad de Pilcopata y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació. (La ciudad de Pilcopata está ubicada en el distrito del Kosñipata dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
 
Jaime tiene 31 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de la cuales todos son independientes. Su actividad económica principal es brindar servicio de transportes de carga en la ciudad de Pilcopata pero también se dedica en sus horas libres a la agricultura. Ya son varios años que se dedica a bridar servicio de transporte y le va muy bien gracias al empeño que pone en su trabajo. Él es una persona emprendedora y trabajadora que pertenece al banco comunal “Paititi” y esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer mantenimiento de su moto carga. Agradece y valora el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas mensuales.
texts.en:
Jaime was born in the city of Pilcopata and still lives there. The city of Pilcopata is located in the District of Kosñipata, which is in Paucartambo Province in the Department of Cusco, Peru.

Jaime is 31 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has three children who are independent. His main business activity is providing cargo transport services in the city of Pilcopata, but he also spends his free time working as a farmer. Jaime has been providing transport services for several years and is doing very well thanks to the effort he puts forth in his work.

He is an enterprising and hardworking individual who is a member of the Communal Bank “Paititi”. Jaime is taking this opportunity to request a loan so that he can pay for the maintenance of his cargo vehicle. He is grateful and values this loan, so he promises to complete the monthly payments.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of his cargo vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase supplies to maintain her crops.

loans.name: Alba Dolores

texts.es:
Alba, se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras. Ella tiene una hija de  tres años de edad, vive con su esposo, sus padres  y sus hermanos; la mercadería la compra en la ciudad y esta la vende en el lugar donde reside. 
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra de naranjas, guineos, aguacates, zapotes, entre otros productos para brindarle variedad a la clientela; este le permitirá obtener más capital de trabajo, ya que le ayudara a comprar más mercadería, aumentar las ventas y su puesto mejorara. 
Su objetivo es adquirir más mercadería  para así vender aun mas, su sueño es tener una mejor calidad de vida ella y su familia, asimismo buscar otro lugar donde vivir.
texts.en:
Alba sells fruits and vegetables. She has one three-year-old daughter. She lives with her husband, her parents, and her siblings. She buys her merchandise in the city and sells it in her neighbourhood.
She will invest this loan in the purchase of oranges, bananas, avocados, sapota fruit, and other products in order to offer variety to her customers. This will allow her to obtain more working capital because it will allow her to purchase more merchandise. Her sales will increase and her stall will improve.
Her goal is to acquire more merchandise so that she can sell even more. Her dream is to have a better quality of life, along with her family. She also wants to find another place to live.

loans.use: to buy oranges, bananas, avocado, sapote fruit, and other products.

loans.name: Bidalla

texts.en:
Bidalla, age 35, is married with four kids. They live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rental bills. 

Bidalla has operated a clothes selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business. She dreams of establishing a boutique shop in the future. With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
SABALI est un groupe de l’association DIANTOYERELA de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 40ans,  6 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de céréales et des condiments à l’image de SALI qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
SALI, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de sel de cuisine,  2 sacs de choux et de 1 sac de poivre.  Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses marchandises à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 12.000FCFA qui lui  
permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Sabali is a group of the Diantoyerela association in N'tentou. It comprises four women who know each other through family and neighbourhood connections. They are on average 40 years old with six children, and run various activities such as buying and selling cereals and condiments, which is the business run by Sali, sitting first from the left in the photo. They live in large traditional households in N'tentou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).
They have been involved in small business for several years and are highly sought-after for their work.
With the hope of satisfying the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first solidarity (group) loan.
Sali intends to use her loan to buy two bags of cooking salt, two bags of cabbage, and one bag of pepper. She gets her supplies in Bamako and Ouelessebougou and sells her goods in Ouelessebougou at retail, in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.
She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 12,0000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Flor Esperanza

texts.es: Doña flor de 36 años de edad vive con su hijo, su mama y su papa en casa propia, ella tiene un puesto de verduras en el mercado que esta cerca de su lugar de residencia desde hace 7 años, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Flor esta solicitando un credito que le permita poder comprar mas mercaderia para surtir su negocio como: cebollas, tomates, papas, lechugas, tambien comprar pollos para venderlos y asi tener mas ganancias y poderle seguir dando a su familia lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en: Flor is 36 years old. She lives with her son and her parents in a home they own. She has had a vegetable stand at the market near her house for seven years. Her earnings allow her to cover some household expenses. Flor is requesting a loan so that she can buy more merchandise to stock her business, such as onions, tomatoes, potatoes, and lettuce, as well as chickens to sell. That way she will be able to increase her income and continue to give her family everything they need.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, lettuce, chickens, etc.

loans.name: Faida Group

texts.fr:
FAIDA est un groupe de l’association DIAMADJIGUI de N’TENTOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans et 4 enfants, elles mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de condiments et d’habillement à l’image de FATOU qui est la première personne assise de la gauche vers la droite de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à N’TENTOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur premier prêt solidaire. 
FATOU, compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, quelques douzaines d’habits pour enfants. Elle s’approvisionne à BAMAKO et OUELESSEBOUGOU et vend ses marchandises à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 20.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Faida is a group of the Diamadjigui association in N'tentou. It comprises four women who know each other through family and neighbourhood connections. They are on average 42 years old with four children, and run various activities such as buying and selling condiments and clothing, which is the business run by Fatou, sitting first from the left in the photo. They live in large traditional households in N'tentou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).
They have been involved in small business for several years and are highly sought-after for their work.
With the hope of satisfying the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program. They are on their first solidarity (group) loan.
Fatou intends to use her loan to buy several dozen sets of children's clothing. She gets her supplies in Bamako and Ouelessebougou and sells her goods in Ouelessebougou at retail, in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.
She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 20,000 FCFA, which will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy children's clothing.

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
Doña María es una mujer joven de 36 años de edad luchadora con muchos deseos de superarse ella es casada y madre de 5 hijos los cuales el mayor termino la primaria, los dos que le siguen están estudiando en primaria en diferentes grados de educación y los últimos 2 están muy pequeños y no estudian. Ella no tiene ningún grado de educación cursado ya que sus padres eran de escasos recursos económicos y no pudieron ayudarla. Fueron ellos los que le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra desde muy pequeña ya que por tradición sus padres, sus abuelos, se han dedicado al cultivo de café. Ella tiene mucha experiencia ya que tiene más de 8 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café y el terreno que ella junto a su esposo cultiva es propio ya que fue una herencia por parte de sus suegros, el cual está ubicado a 50 metros de distancia de su casa de habitación al cual se traslada en compañía de su esposo y sus hijos a pie diariamente para su asistencia y otros que hacen de su cultivo productivo.

Doña María solicita ayuda para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para su cultivo de café ya que por medio de estos productos ella podrá asegurar su cosecha y podrá evitar que sean infectadas por plagas y enfermedades como la roya.

Sus sueños son de hacer de sus cultivos más productivos ya que por medio de esto ella podrá asegurar el futuro de sus hijos formando un capital para darle sus estudios y tengan un mejor estilo de vida y mejores ingresos cuando ellos se gradúen a nivel universitario.
texts.en:
Maria is a 36 year-old woman who is tenacious and who has a strong desire to succeed.  She is married, and is the mother of 5 children.  Her oldest has finished elementary school, the next two are in different grades of elementary school, and the youngest two are not yet old enough to attend school.  Maria did not attend school at all, because her parents were poor and could not help her.  They were the ones who taught her to farm from the time that she was very young, because it has been a tradition in her family going back to her grandparents to cultivate coffee.  

Maria has a lot of experience, as she's been growing coffee for more than 8 years.  She and her husband own the land that they work together, because they inherited it from her husband's parents.  Their land is located 50 meters from their house.  Maria, her husband, and their children walk to the fields each day to care for their crops and  make their land productive.  

Maria is requesting help to buy organic and chemical fertilizers for her coffee crops, because with these products she will be assured of a good harvest, and she will avoid the pests and crop diseases such as the Roya fungus.  Maria's dream is to make her farm more productive, because in this way she will be able to ensure the future of her children by saving for their education, so that they will have a better living standard and more income once they graduate from the university.

loans.use: to buy organic and chemical fertilizers for her coffee crops

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
BENKADI est un groupe de l’association KOTOTALA de OUELESSEBOUGOU. Il regroupe 4 femmes qui se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et de voisinage. Elles ont une moyenne d’âge de 42 ans,  4 enfants et mènent différentes activités  telles l’achat vente de  condiments et de céréales et à l’image de SETOU qui est la première personne assise de la droite vers la gauche de la photo. Elles vivent dans des grandes familles traditionnelles à OUELESSEBOUGOU dans la  préfecture de Kati (Région de Koulikoro, République du Mali). 
Elles sont dans le petit commerce depuis plusieurs années et sont très sollicitées dans leurs activités. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin croissant de leur clientèle, les membres du groupe ont décidé d’intégrer le programme crédit de Soro Yiriwaso il y’a trois ans. Elles sont à leur cinquième prêt solidaire. 
SETOU, qui est la présidente du groupe et très connue à OUELESSEBOUGOU et excelle dans la vente de céréales. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter, 2 sacs de riz de production locale et de 1 sac de maïs. Elle s’approvisionne à OUELESSEBOUGOU et dans les villages environnants et vend ses marchandises à OUELESSEBOUGOU, en détail, au comptant et à crédit, à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes.   
Elle espère sur un bénéfice mensuel de 23.000FCFA somme qui lui  permettra de rembourser le prêt et de réinvestir dans son activité.
texts.en:
Benkadi is a group of the Kototala association in Ouelessebougou. It comprises four women who know each other through family and neighbourhood connections. They are on average 42 years old with four children, and run various activities such as buying and selling condiments and cereals, which is the business run by Setou, sitting first from the right in the photo. They live in large traditional households in Ouelessebougou, in the Kati prefecture (Koulikoro region, Republic of Mali).
They have been involved in small business for several years and are highly sought-after for their work.
With the hope of satisfying the growing needs of their clientele, the group members decided to join Soro Yiriwaso's loan program three years ago. They are on their fifth solidarity (group) loan.
Setou, who is the group's president and very well known in Ouelessebougou, excels in her business of selling cereals. She intends to use her loan to buy two sacks of locally produced rice and one sack of maize. She gets her supplies in Ouelessebougou and the neighbouring towns, and sells her goods in Ouelessebougou at retail, in cash and on credit to a clientele composed of men and women.
She hopes to earn a monthly profit of 23,000 FCFA, a sum that will allow her to repay the loan and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To buy cereals.

loans.name: Ma. Victoria

texts.en:
Ma. Victoria works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Victoria has been in this business for 5 years now. 

Ma. Victoria requested a 30,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to purchase additional fishing net for her business. In the future, Ma. Victoria would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing net for her business

loans.name: Antolina

texts.es: Doña antonila vive con sus hijos en casa propia, ella se dedica a la compra y venta de articulos de plastico y cobre desde hace varios años cuando ya ha comprado suficientes productos los va almacenando en sacos asi como muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a los lugares que compran ese tipo de articulos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar. Doña Antolina solicita un credito para poder comprar todo tipo de plastico y cobre por mayor ya que ha tenido ultimamente mucha demanda y asi ella pueda tener mejores ganancias y podra darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Antonila lives in her own home with her children.  She has been engaged in buying and selling plastic and copper items for several years.  When she has purchased enough products, she stores them in sacks, as shown in the photograph, and then sells them to places that buy these types of items.  With the profits she earns from her sales, she manages to cover some household expenses.  Antolina is requesting a loan to be able to purchase all types of wholesale plastic and copper because she has had great demand lately.  In this way, she can earn higher profits and be able to provide her family with better financial stability.

loans.use: to purchase plastic and copper items.

loans.name: Nelson De Jesús

texts.es:
Nelson de 50 años de edad, creó su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar. Con más de 10 años de experiencia en el sector don Nelson es reconocido en su barrio como un hombre que ha logrado salir adelante con disciplina y esfuerzo. Gracias a su negocio a logrado mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. 
Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio, con el fin de aumentar sus ingresos. Razón que lo ha impulsado a solicitar un crédito para la compra de surtido. 
Desea ver a su familia unida y sin carencias económicas.
texts.en:
Nelson is 50 years old. He built his own business selling staple goods. He has more than 10 years of experience in the business, and his neighbors know him as a man who has achieved success through discipline and hard work. Thanks to his business, he has been able to improve his family's living conditions.
His greatest dream is to expand his business so he an increase his income. He is therefore requesting a loan to buy merchandise. He hopes for a strong family that does not suffer economic deprivation.

loans.use: to buy staple goods to sell.

loans.name: Kantutas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “KANTUTA” iniciará el noveno ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Rebeca es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: tienda de barrio, venta de dulces, venta de chamarras, venta de ropa, venta de botones, confección de deportivos, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Rebeca es integrante, ella indica que hace tres ciclos que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de Ferretería; da a conocer que este negocio lo emprendió por hace siete años por la herencia que le dejo su madre.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de clavos, pernos) que adquirirá de las ferias de la Ciudad de Oruro y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener en lo posible a su hogar pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta el área de salud y crédito.
texts.en:
The village bank KANTUTA is starting its ninth loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Senkata regional office. The group has eight members, and Rebeca is the chair of the board of directors. The members of the group earn their living in a variety of ways, including running a general store, making athletic clothing, and selling sweets, jackets, clothing, buttons, and food.
This loan will help these microentrepreneurs. Rebeca notes that she has had three loans with Pro Mujer, which she joined at the invitation of a friend who is a member of the institution. She currently has a hardware store, which she says she started seven years ago with the money she inherited from her mother.
She will use this loan to buy nails and bolts at the markets in the city of Oruro and then sell them in her business. This work allows her to bring in an income to support her family, since she lives with her partner and has two children.
When we ask her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she answers that she likes the health care and the loans.

loans.use: to buy nails and bolts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase items to make dresses.

loans.name: Omaira Del Socorro

texts.es:
Omaira de 42 años de edad, es una microempresaria dedicada a la confección a terceros, actividad que le garantiza bienestar a su familia y mejores condiciones económicas. 
En su vida ha tenido que afrontar grandes retos, pues su familia nunca tuvo los recursos para ofrecerle educación, por lo cual tuvo que trabajar y estudiar para alcanzar sus sueños, 
Omaira es hoy un ejemplo de disciplina y esfuerzo para su comunidad.
Gracias a la oportunidad que tuvo de laborar en una empresa por más de cinco años, adquirió experiencia y el dinero para montar su negocio, el cual se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos. Con el propósito de ampliar su capacidad de producción, se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que pretende realizar adecuaciones locativas en su vivienda para ampliar la zona de trabajo.
texts.en: Omaira, 42 years old, is a microentrepreneur who makes clothing as a subcontractor. Her work ensures her family's well-being and improved economic circumstances. She has faced great challenges in her life, and she had to work and study hard to achieve her dreams. Omaira is an model of discipline and dedication in her community. Thanks to the opportunity she had to work for a company for more than five years, she acquired experience and enough money to start her own business, which now provides all of her income. Hoping to increase her production capacity, she is requesting a loan that she will use to do some construction in her home to expand her work space.

loans.use: to do some construction in her home to expand her work space.

loans.name: Yessica Natalia

texts.es:
Yessica  de 27 años de edad,  se dedica a la venta de productos por catálogo, labor que le ha permitido generar los recursos suficientes para el sostenimiento de su hijo de cinco meses de edad. 
Asegura, que su trabajo en ocasiones se vuelva muy pesado debido  a que debe caminar por largo tiempo en búsqueda de clientes y entrega de pedidos.
Se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora y esforzada cuando se trata de cumplir sus proyectos y deseos. Con el fin de entregar los pedidos pendientes, Yessica se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de productos de belleza y aseo personal, ya que no cuenta con el capital propio para realizar dicha inversión.
texts.en:
23-year old Yessica sells products from a catalog, a job that has allowed her to earn enough money to support her 5-month old son. She comments that at times she comes home very tired as she has to walk a long way looking for customers and delivering orders.

Yessica is a hardworking woman who makes a strong effort especially when it comes to completing projects. So that she can fill existing orders, Yessica is seeking a loan to buy beauty and toiletry products as she doesn’t have enough capital of her own to do this.

loans.use: buy beauty and toiletry products

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “TERESA DE JESUS”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Yanet ella es soltera y tiene 42 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de ropas y lencería como polos, medias y truzas, la socia vende en forma independiente llevando a las diferentes tiendas, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m, la socia ya tiene 8 años y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es ampliar el negocio de venta de ropas y lencería. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar medias, truzas y polos y también chompas, pantalones y casacas.

Los socios que estan pegados a la foto grupal se les tomo despues la foto porque pidieron permiso por motivos de trabajo.
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de librería.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The Teresa de Jesus community bank is located in the district of Cusco, which is part of the province and department of Cusco.

Yanet is a member of the group.  She is single, 42 years old, and has two children.  She works selling clothing and underwear such as undershirts, socks, and underwear.  She sells independently by bringing the clothing to different stores.  She works from 8:00am until 6:00pm.  She has been doing this work for eight years and it is going very well.  Her dream is to expand her business.  She is requesting this loan to purchase socks, underwear, undershirts, as well as sweaters, pants, and coats.

The members who are in the small photos attached to the group photo were taken later because they asked permission to miss the meeting for work reasons.  The other members of the group work selling beauty products, selling clothing, at a grocery store, and selling books.  

Yanet is grateful to everyone who has been a part of this dream and promises to make her repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to purchase socks, underwear, undershirts, sweaters, pants, and coats.

loans.name: Juan Ramón

texts.es:
Juan Ramón es soltero con una responsabilidad de dos persona bajo su cargo, vive en  Managua, es trabajador  de una empresa del estado, donde se desempeña como conductor desde hace doce años, responsable luchador con actitud de superación para poder darle una vida mejor a su familia.

 El  crédito que solicita a CEPRODEL lo utilizara  para comprar  materiales de electricidad, para cambiar todo el sistema eléctrico ya que esta en mala condiciones y pagar mano de obra. 

Con este financiamiento lo va invertir en  a segurar la vivienda de su familia, porque su ingreso son muy bajo y no ha podido  hacer esa inversión, pero tiene fe con el apoyo de KIVA-CEPRODEL que lo va a lograr.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón is single and responsible for two people under his care. He lives in Managua and has worked for a state company as a driver for twelve years. He is a responsible and hard worker with a take-charge attitude. He wants to get ahead in order to give his family a better life.
He will use this loan, requested from CEPRODEL, for the purchase of electric materials in order to change the whole electrical system, which is in bad shape, and to pay the labourers.
With this loan, he will invest in the security of his family's home. Because his income is very low, he has not been able to make this investment. He has faith that with the support of Kiva and CEPRODEL he will succeed.

loans.use: to buy construction materials.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 31 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school, Mary Jane works very hard to provide for them.

Mary Jane runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Mary Jane has been in this business for one year.

In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a home solar power station, batteries, and a television for his house.

loans.name: Suriya

texts.en:
Suriya is a 53-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of four children. Her husband owns a fruit shop in the market, which is the only source of income for the family. He sells apples, bananas, and oranges in his shop. Presently, he is interested in offering more variety to his customers, which will help him to increase his net income and savings as well. However, due to the lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, his wife Suriya has requested a loan of 38,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan so that she can help her husband to purchase a variety of fruits from the field and sell them in the market at a profitable price. This will help him to increase his customers and daily income. With the profit amount, her husband wants to grow his business in the future. 

Suriya dreams of spending her life with better facilities and hopes that she will be able to provide a better education to her children. Suriya is very thankful for Kiva and BRAC Pakiatan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of fruits to sell.

loans.name: Irma  Yoland

texts.es: Doña Irma vive con su hijo en casa propia, ella tiene un negocio de pupuseria y tortilleria desde hace varios años trabaja por la mañana en la tortilleria y por la tarde en la pupuseria de lunes a domingo, tiene mucha clientela pues es una persona muy amable y trabajadora con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, Doña Irma solicita un credito para poder comprar todo lo necesario para elaborar sus alimentos como: maiz, quesillo, chicharron, tomates, frijoles, etc. para obtener mejores ganancias y seguirle dando a su hijo lo que necesita sin limitacion alguna.
texts.en:
Irma lives in her own home with her son.  She has owned a *pupuseria and *tortillería business for several years.  She works in the tortillería in the morning and in the pupuseria in the afternoon, Monday through Sunday.  She has many customers because she is very friendly and hardworking.  She manages to cover some household expenses with the profits she earns.   Irma is requesting the loan so she can purchase everything she needs to prepare her meals such as corn, quesillos [tortillas with cream cheese filling], pork cracklings, tomatoes, beans, and other items.  In this way, she will earn higher profits and continue giving her son what he needs without any limitations.
  
*pupuseria - shop selling stuffed tortillas
*tortillería – tortilla shop

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, "quesillo", pork cracklings, etc.

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en: Hilaria is a 65-year-old married woman and a mother of five adult children. They live in Bohol, Philippines. Hilaria has operated a hog raising business for more than four years. Her husband is a farmer. Hilaria requests a loan to buy feed, food supplements, and vaccines for her pigs. With this, she will be able to improve her ventures thus increasing her profit and income. Hilaria dreams of experiencing the fullness of life with her family.

loans.use: to buy feed, food supplements, and vaccines for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria Alicia

texts.es: Doña gloria se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años siembra frijol y maiz y con las ventas que realiza de sus cosechas logra solventar los gastos que tiene en su hogar, es una mujer responsable, honesta y trabajadora vive con su esposo y sus 2 nietos. Ella esta solicitando un credito para poder comprar insumos abonos, semillas, pesticidas, herbicidas, fertilizantes, etc. y tambien para mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotogarfia que es donde siembra sus cultivos ya que con lo que gana no le alcanza para cubrir esos gastos y asi tener mejores ingresos y tener un mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Sra. Gloria has worked as a farmer for several years. She grows beans and corn. With the money she earns she manages to pay for household expenses. She is a responsible, honest woman who works hard. She lives with her husband and two grandchildren.

Gloria is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies such as manure, seeds, pesticide, herbicide, fertilizer etc. She also wishes to improve the land. The photograph shows where she plants her crops.

The money she earns from the land is not enough to cover expenses so she is hoping for a bigger income and more economic stability.

loans.use: buy manure, seeds, pesticide, herbicide, fertilizer etc. and improve the land

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 44 years old and married with three children. With two of her children currently in school, Alma works very hard to provide for them.

Alma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like noodles, cooking oil, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store.

Alma has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, cooking oil, snack foods, candies, etc. 

Alma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like noodles, cooking oil, snack foods, candies, etc. to sell in her general store

loans.name: G.s El Pantanal Group

texts.es:
La señora María  es una persona  muy  emprendedora vive con  sus  4 hijos en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta  de refrescos  y ropa  usada desde hace más de 12 años. 
Doña María el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de   refrescos, pantalones, vestidos, blusas, faldas, camisas, calzonetas, etc.  Con el crédito  espera  el aumento de sus ventas debido a que contara con más capital fresco y  que ofrecer a los clientes que la visitan.
Doña María  al igual que sus compañeras de grupo espera que mejore su situación económica y que se vea reflejado con esta inversión. En unos años sueña con que su negocio  este posicionado como el más grande y  conocido de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia  a que se convierta en personas de bien  para la sociedad .
Doña Cintya su negocio es la  venta  de  accesorios para vehículos  desde hace 4 años 
Doña su negocio es la mini  pulpería  desde hace 5 años.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Abril  del 2013
texts.en:
María is a very enterprising person.  She lives with her four children in a community in the southern part of Honduras.  She has worked selling soft drinks and used clothing for more than 12 years.  María will use this loan to purchase soft drinks, pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, swimsuits, and other items.  She hopes that the loan will increase her sales since she will have more fresh capital and more to offer to her customers who visit.

The group hopes that the loan will improve their financial situation and see it reflected with this investment.  In a few years, María hopes that her business will be positioned as the largest and most well-known in the area so that she can continue supporting her family, who she hopes become good people for society.  

Cynthia has had a business selling accessories for vehicles for four years and Sara has worked at her small grocery store for five years.

loans.use: to purchase soft drinks, pants, dresses, blouses, skirts, t-shirts, and swimsuits for her business.

loans.name: Virginia Esperanza

texts.es: Virginia, solicita un nuevo préstamo por la necesidad de invertir más en la venta de comida, ya que los créditos son una excelente fuente de financiamiento; este le permitirá comprar carnes, repollo, tomates, aceite, entre otros productos. El crédito anterior le ayudo a aumentar sus ingresos y las ganancias las invirtió en los gastos del  hogar. Con la inversión de Kiva ha mejorado sus condiciones económicas y esto le ha permitido tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Virginia is requesting a new loan as she needs to invest more money in food sales and the loans are an excellent source of financing. This allows her to buy meats, cabbage, tomatoes, oil and other products. The previous loan helped her to raise her income and she invested the earnings in household expenses. She has used the Kiva investment to improve her financial situation and this has allowed her a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy meats, cabbage, tomatoes, oil and other products.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with three children.

Melanie works hard to provide for her family. She sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Melanie has borrowed and repaid 12 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been selling charcoal for eight years and also earns an income from her general store.

Melanie aspires to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Fe

texts.en: Fe is a fish vendor from the town of Ubay, Bohol. She is a married woman and has four children. Fe has been in the fish vending business for more than 15 years now. Her husband works as a fisherman. Fe is asking for a loan to buy more fish to sell to the people in her area. With this, she will be able to augment her stocks and increase her sales and profit. Fe dreams of improving her business and saving money for the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Irma

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la vena de ropa. Ella vive con su familia, su esposo y sus hijos, ellos dependen de sus ingresos, no tiene familiares en el extranjero; el negocio lo aprendió de su esposo quien se dedica a la misma actividad, trabaja de manera ambulante, no tiene horario establecido.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar variedad de ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, tales como camisas, blusas, pantalones, shorts, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a adquirir todo lo necesario para vender y asimismo atender mejor  a sus clientes, ya que tendrá mercadería al gusto de los suyos.
Su sueño es tener casa propia, preparar académicamente a sus hijos y vivir feliz.
texts.en:
Rosa sells clothing. She lives with her family- her husband and children. They depend on her income. She does not have family abroad.
She learned this business from her husband, who does the same work. She works door-to-door and does not have a fixed schedule.
This loan will allow her to buy a variety of clothing for men, women and children. She will buy items such as shirts, blouses, pants, and shorts. This investment will allow her to acquire everything necessary for her sales. She will be able to provide better customer service because she will have merchandise suited to their tastes.
Her dream is to have her own home, to provide her children with a good education, and to live happily.

loans.use: to buy shirts, blouses, pants, shorts, and other items.

loans.name: Omar Antonio

texts.es: Omar de 33 de años de edad vive junto a su esposa y sus 2 hijos de 8 y 4 años de edad en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y pipianes, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cosechas, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefiere por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el necesita invertir por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, insecticida, herbicida, etc. Omar tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica
texts.en:
33-year old Omar lives with his wife and two children aged 8 and 4 in his own house. He earns his living growing corn and chilies, work he’s been doing for several years. As a result he has lots of experience which has allowed him to obtain better harvests. He sells the produce in nearby communities where he has many customers who buy from him because of the quality of his goods, his fair prices, and above all for his good service. 

Now Omar needs money to invest in his business so he is seeking a loan to buy corn seeds, insecticide, herbicide etc. He has good references from his acquaintances regarding repayment of money and is very responsible. He is certain that he can pay off his debt according to the established schedule and at the same time is confident that he will provide his family with economic security.

loans.use: buy herbicide, fertilizer, seeds, manure etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a freezer.

loans.name: Asia

texts.en:
Asia, age 28, is a married woman with one child who attends school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past six years, Asia has operated a business selling charcoal. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she operates a grocery shop, which is her other source of livelihood. Her major challenge in the business is the high cost of transportation.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and green groceries for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase 20 bags of charcoal for resale and green groceries for resale.

loans.name: Vilma Susana

texts.es:
La clienta Vilma vive en Guayaquil. Ella empezó su tienda cuando se cambio de casa y fue hay que puso el negocio por su ubicación. En la cual tiene una tienda con viveres de primera necesidad  donde vende enlatados, granos, confites.

Ella trabaja con ayuda de su esposo y su hijo. Sus dificultades es la competencia de tiendas. Está casada y su a veces trabaja de albañil, tiene hijos mayores de edad.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar arroz, azúcar y unos anaqueles. Su sueño es que la tienda crezca y poder tener una distribuidora.
texts.en:
Vilma lives in Guayaquil. She opened her store at the time she moved to a new house since she wanted her business to be in the same location. Vilma sells basic necessities in her store such as canned goods, grains, and sweets. She works with the help of her husband and son. Her difficulties include dealing with the competition from other stores. Vilma is married and her husband works occasionally as a bricklayer. They have grown children.

With this loan, Vilma will buy rice, sugar, and a few shelves. Her dream is to grow her store and to become a distributor.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and a few shelves.

loans.name: Lassine

texts.fr:
Monsieur  LASSINE  est âgé de 46 ans et vit avec ses huit enfants et son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à DONGORONA, un des villages de la sous préfecture  de Ouelessebougou,  Région de Koulikoro.
LASSINE n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son grand frère, qui  excellait dans le secteur. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, il décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième individuel  qui servira à acheter, 4 tonnes de céréales (maïs, mil, fonio) auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONA et environnants qu’il gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako.
LASSINE espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 85.000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
Mr. LASSINE is 46 years old and lives with his eight children and wife in a traditional family in DONGORONA, a village in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in Région de Koulikoro. 

LASSINE did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying, stocking, and selling of grains. He learned this business from his older brother, who excelled in the sector.  

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the third loan, he is on his fourth individual loan, which will be used to purchase 4 tonnes of grains (corn, millet, 'fonio') from peasant producers in and around DONGORONA that he will keep for at least three months. He essentially sells in bulk to a customer base composed of retailers from the big cities, such as Bamako.

LASSINE hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Jose Maria

texts.es: Don jose de 55 años de edad, es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos, El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela donde siembra maiz y frijol; sus productos son de muy buena calidad cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en el granero que muestra la fotografia para luego salir a comercializarlos a los diferentes mercados que estan cerca de su lugar de residencia. Jose solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, abonos, semillas entre otras cosas que necesita para su siembra, él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Jose, 55, is very friendly and hard-working, he lives with his wife and their two children. He works very hard on his own plot of land where he grows corn and beans: his products are great quality and his harvest is stocked in the storeroom at the granary, seen in his photograph, from where he will sell it at the various markets near to his home. 

Jose is asking for a loan from INTEGRAL to count on the money he needs to invest in agricultural supplies like pesticides and fertilisers, manure, seeds and other things that he needs for planting crops. 

He is anxious to increase his sales to be able to receive improved earnings and provide his family with financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, manure, seeds etc.

loans.name: Drissa

texts.fr:
DRISSA  est âgé de 40 ans et vit avec ses sept enfants et ses épouses dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
DRISSA  n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école. Très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle maternel, qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé le troisième prêt il est à son quatrième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 5 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONAN et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
DRISSA espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
DRISSA is 40 years old and lives with his seven children and wives in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in Région de Koulikoro. DRISSA did not have the chance to go to school. Early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying, stocking, and selling of grains. He learned this business from his maternal uncle, who used to be a major merchant of grains.  

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the third loan, he is on his fourth individual loan, which will be used to purchase 5 tonnes of grains from peasant producers in and around DONGORONA that he will keep for at least three months. He essentially sells in bulk to a customer base composed of retailers from the big cities, such as Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.

DRISSA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 90,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
ISSA  est âgé de 50 ans et vit avec ses cinq enfants et ses épouses dans la sous préfecture de OUELESSEBOUGOU, Région de KOULIKORO.
ISSA   n’a pas eu la chance  d’aller à l’école, alors très tôt  il s’intéressa aux activités génératrices de revenus notamment à l’achat stockage vente de céréales. Elle a appris cette activité auprès de son oncle  qui  fut jadis un grand commerçant de céréales et bien d’autres articles. 
Dans le souci de satisfaire sa clientèle en nette croissance, elle décida de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso. Après avoir correctement           remboursé les  trois prêts précédents  il est à son quantième prêt individuel  qui servira à acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales auprès des paysans producteurs de DONGORONAN et environnants qu’elle gardera pendant au moins 3 mois. Il vend  essentiellement en gros à une clientèle constituée de revendeurs venant des grandes villes telles Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.
ISSA  espère réaliser un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt et  être réinvestir le reste dans les activités.
texts.en:
ISSA is 50 years old and lives with his five children and wives in the sub-prefecture of Ouelessebougou, in Région de Koulikoro. ISSA did not have the chance to go to school. So early on, he became interested in revenue-generating businesses, especially in the buying, stocking, and selling of grains. He learned this business from his uncle, who used to be a major merchant of grains and many other goods.  

Concerned about satisfying his clearly growing customer base, he decided to collaborate with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. After having correctly repaid the third loan, he is on his fourth individual loan, which will be used to purchase 3 tonnes of grains from peasant producers in and around DONGORONA that he will keep for at least three months. He essentially sells in bulk to a customer base composed of retailers from the big cities, such as Bamako, OUELESSEBOUGOU.

ISSA hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000 francs CFA that will be used to pay back the loan and to reinvest the rest in his business.

loans.use: to purchase grains

loans.name: Juan Rodolfo

texts.es: Don Juan es muy amable y trabajador, vive con su esposa y su hijo.
