El trabaja muy duro en su propia parcela en la que actualmente ha sembrado maíz, sus productos son de muy buena calidad y la parcela está ubicada en una zona de fácil acceso lo que es muy bueno para él porque le beneficia que sus clientes puedan llegar inmediatamente hasta el lugar, sus cultivos los almacena en los graneros que muestra la fotografia. Don Juan solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL para contar con el dinero necesario e invertir en la compra de insumos agrícolas como controles de plaga y fertilizantes, además de semillas de maiz para iniciar la siembra cuanto antes él ansía aumentar sus ventas para poder percibir mayores ganancias y tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Juan is very kind and hardworking.  He lives with his wife and their son.  He works very hard on the farm land he owns, where he has currently planted corn.  His products are of very good quality and the land is located in an area that is easy to access.  This is very good for him because he benefits since his customers can come immediately to that location.  He stores his crops in the silos shown in the photograph.

Juan is requesting this loan from INTEGRAL to have the necessary money to invest in the purchase of agricultural supplies such as pest controls and fertilizer as well as corn seeds to start the planting sooner.  He hopes to increase sales to earn more income and have a more stable financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and other items.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.en:
Marlene is 49 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Marlene has been raising pigs for three years and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport.

Marlene is borrowing 11,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase additional feed for her pigs. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed for her pigs

loans.name: Ines Yolanda

texts.es:
La clienta Ines vive en Guayaquil. Todo empezó cuando pudo comprar un auto para una ayuda mas en los ingresos de su familia, en la actulidad ella alquila el carro todo el día a una persona para que recorra las calles de Guayaquil y brinde servicios como taxista.

Su dificultad en su negocio son las lluvias ya que tiene miedo que se llegue a dañar el carro. Está separada no tiene hijos menor.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar focos y llantas para darle asi mantenimiento al carro. Su sueño es que su carro se pague solo y tener más vehículos para alquilar
texts.en:
Ines lives in Guayaquil. It all began when she bought a car to help generate income for her family. She currently rents out the car all day to an individual who drives through the streets of Guayaquil and offers his services as a taxi driver. The difficulty with her business is dealing with the rain since she is afraid that it will damage the car. Ines is separated and does not have underage children.

With this loan, she will buy headlights and tires so that she can maintain her vehicle. Her dream is to see the car pay for itself and to have more vehicles that she can make available for rent.

loans.use: to buy headlights and tires.

loans.name: Jose Ovidio

texts.es: José, requiere de un nuevo préstamo para iniciar con la preparación del terreno para el cultivo de maíz. Este le permitirá cubrir los gastos para limpiar el espacio de tierra, tambien adquirir abono, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas entre otros y así tenerlo listo para la época de la siembra.El crédito anterior le permitió adquirir lo necesario para la carpinteria, asimismo obtener ingresos y con ello logro ayudarle a su familia.
texts.en:
José needs a new loan to start preparing his land for growing corn. This will cover the expenses for clearing the land and buying manure, herbicides, pesticides and other things and he will then be ready for the sowing season. 

The previous loan allowed him to buy items he required for carpentry, as well as obtaining income, which he used to support his family.

loans.use: to cover the expenses for clearing his land and buying manure, herbicides, pesticides and other things.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es: Don Eduardo es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarles lo mejor a sus hijos. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y su hijo de 12 años de edad quien estudia actualmente, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultor siembra maíz tambien trabaja como jornalero en la zona. Don Eduardo desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros y mejorar el terreno donde siembra que es el que meustra en la fotografia. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Eduardo is a very responsible man with household obligations, as he is always known to provide the best for his children.

He currently lives with his wife and their 12 year old son, who is currently in education. He is very hard-working and always works with a smile and enthusiasm. He farms corn for a living and also works as a day labourer in their area.

Eduardo wants to increase sales so he visited the INTEGRAL offices to request a loan, which will allow him to buy seeds, manure, fertilisers, pesticides and other things and to improve the land where he will sow his seeds, which is shown in the photograph. 

He wants to count on the support he has requested as he has no other monetary income and this will allow him to keep providing his family with bread every day.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, pesticides and to improve the land.

loans.name: Marcos Patricio

texts.es:
El cliente Marcos vive en Duran. Todo empezó cuando sus padres le enseñaron la actividad de venta de viveres. Poco a poco el mejoro las ventas de viveres y emprendio con una pequeña tienda. En la actualidad su trabajo lo hace en el transcurso de la semana vendiendo verduras, vegetales, carnes. 

La dificultad que él tiene en su negocio son los ladrones ya que hay en el sector  donde él vive. Es casado su esposa lo ayuda en la tienda si tiene 2 hijos los cuales estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo va a comprar abastos, pollos y legumbres. Su sueño es poder comprarse  un vehículo.
texts.en:
Marcos lives in Duran.  He started selling food when his parents taught him this business.  He gradually increased his sales of food items, and started up a small store.  This is now the work that he does; each week he is selling produce, vegetables, and meat.

The difficulty he faces is in his business is that in the area where he lives there are thieves.  He is married, and his wife helps him with the store.  He has 2 children who attend public school.

With this loan, he will buy stock for his store including chicken and vegetables. His dream is to be able to buy a car.

loans.use: to buy stock for his store, including chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Adalberto Aquiles

texts.es:
Adalberto, solicita un nuevo préstamo para mantenerse trabajando y así obtener ingresos  para los gastos familiares. Este le permitirá comprar semilla de maíz, herbicidas, plaguicidas, insecticidas para realizar el cultivo. 
El crédito anterior le permitió darse los gastos alimenticios y así llevando una mejor estabilidad de vida, ya que las condiciones economicas han mejorado.
texts.en: Adalberto is requesting a new loan in order to keep working and obtain income for family expenses. This loan will allow him to buy corn seeds, herbicides, pesticides, and insecticides in order to cultivate his crops. His previous loan allowed him to afford food expenses and bring more stability to his life, since his economic conditions improved.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, herbicide, pesticide, and insecticide, in order to cultivate his crops

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es:
Rosa, se dedica a la venta de medicina popular y natural, lo realiza desde hace un tiempo atrás como una fuente generadora de ingresos. Ella está casada, tiene dos hijos que están estudiando.
El préstamo que requiere lo invertirá en la compra medicina popular y natural tales como: uña de gato, nonis, entre otros; esta inversión le ayudara a mejorar sus ventas, ofrecer más variedad de productos a la clientela y asimismo tener una mejor calidad de vida.
Su sueño es mejorar parte de su vivienda para vivir mejor.
texts.en: Rosa makes a living selling popular, natural medicines. She has been doing this for some time as a means of generating income.  She is married and has two children who are studying. The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of popular, natural medicine such as cat's claw, noni, and more. This investment will help her to improve her sales, offer a larger variety of products to her clientele and also have a better quality of life. Her dream is to improve part of her home in order to live better.

loans.use: To buy popular, natural medicines such as cat's claw, noni, and more

loans.name: Adiya

texts.en: Mr. Adiya, 31, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (a portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. He has been providing taxi service to local people since 2010 and has accumulated a vast amount of experience in picking up customers, driving them quickly to their destinations, and finding shorter routes. Recently, his wife gave birth to their second child and took maternity leave. He is requesting a loan of 1,300,000 MNT to purchase furniture, such as a sofa, drawers, a chair and a table. Thus he can create comfortable accommodations for his family and then work enthusiastically. The borrower is very hard-working individual who deeply cares for his family.

loans.use: to buy a sofa, drawers, a chair and a table for the family’s ger (a portable felt dwelling).

loans.name: Meldrina

texts.en: Meldrina works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. Meldrina requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle. Meldrina has been in this business for four years, and she earns additional income from fattening pigs. She successfully repaid her previous loan and is now applying for a new loan to build up her motorcycle transport and pig fattening businesses. In the future, Meldrina would like to build and expand her business in order to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle she uses in her transport business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family. She has a repair shop business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling home appliances. Melanie is borrowing 29,500 Philippine pesos through NWTF to purchase additional equipment for her repair shop business.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities with her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional equipment for her repair shop business

loans.name: Simiy

texts.en: A widower, the father of one schoolchild, SimIy is 29 years old and a villager in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province. He manages one and a half hectares of farmland and plants rice as his main source of income, as he has done for nine years, and he is able to earn up to 11,500 KHR per day. Simly is new to VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and is applying for 2,000,000 KHR in order to build a decent wooden house covered with tiles. He keenly hopes that he can own a proper house for his child.

loans.use: to build a decent wooden house covered with tiles.

loans.name: Hadija

texts.en: Hadija, 24 years old, is a married woman and lives with her husband, Said, in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are for food and rent. Hadija has operated a business selling firewood and charcoal for the past three years. She sells from home, to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned stiff competition and the high cost of transportation as her major challenges in business. With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase a supply of firewood and charcoal to sell. She dreams of expanding her business to earn more income in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a supply of firewood and charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Juan Ramon

texts.es:
El Sr. Juan Ramón tiene viviendo en Piedras Negras desde hace 30 años, es un hombre casado, responsable y trabajador, él junto a su esposa siempre han buscado la manera de generar ingreso para así darle una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
El Sr. Ramón es electrico, trabaja por su propia cuenta, esta habilidad se la inculcado a sus hijos y han aprendido muy pronto, el hijo mayor es el que le ayuda a realizar los trabajos.
Pide apoyo através de KIVA para comprar herramienta ya que la que utiliza es muy costosa y con la que cuenta se encuentra desgastada y así seguir brindando su servicio a sus clientes con trabajos de  muy buena calidad.
texts.en:
Juan Ramón has had a house in Piedras Negras for the last 30 years. He is a married man who is responsible and hard-working. Together with his wife, he has looked for the best way to generate income in order to provide his children with a better quality of life.

Ramón is an electrician, working independently. He has instilled this ability in his children and they have learned very quickly. His oldest son is the one who helps him do his work. 

He is requesting support through Kiva in order to buy tools since those he uses are very costly and he is depending on tools that are very age-worn. This way he will be able to continue offering services and very high-quality work to his clients.

loans.use: to buy tools

loans.name: Gocha

texts.en:
Gocha is 46 years old. He lives in a small village in Kvareli District with his wife, his three children and his mother, who receives a retirement pension. Gocha applied for loans from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan applications were always rejected because of his low income and the family’s poor living conditions. The only source of the income for the family is from an agricultural business. They have a vineyard and sell wine locally. It hardly produces enough to buy food for the family. According to Credo's evaluation, the family belongs to the “subsistence poor” category. Gocha applied for a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Gocha has been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. 

The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits on soft conditions to rural poor people who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Gocha, will purchase calves. After buying the the calves, he will be able to raise them and produce dairy products to sell. This will increase the family income. The new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves to raise and produce dairy products.

loans.name: Las De La Unidad Group

texts.es: Las de la unidad son un grupo de mujeres muy trabajadoras, tienen 10 ciclos con su crédito y son muy unidas. María Angélica es una mujer de 33 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 8, 13 y 15 años, dos de ellos estudian; además de ser ama de casa, también se dedica a la venta de tortillas de harina, y el crédito la ayudará a comprar una plancha para poder coserlas mas fácil y rápido, ya que en la estufa en la que las cocía era muy lento el proceso. María Angélica desea hacer crecer su negocio y en un futuro tener  un local establecido y un carro para moverse mejor. Este grupo es muy responsable pero sobre todo es muy puntual con sus pagos.
texts.en:
"Las de la Unidad" es a group of very hard-working women.  They have been through 10 loan cycles and are very united.  

María Angélica is a 33-year old woman.  She is married and has 3 children who are 8, 13 and 15 years old.  Two of them study.  In addition to being a homemaker, she also makes a living selling flour tortillas.  The loan will help her buy a griddle in order to cook them faster and more easily, since the process was very slow with the stove on which she was cooking them.

María Angélica would like to grow her business and in the future have an established store and a car to get around better.

This group is very responsible, but above all very punctual with their payments.

loans.use: to buy a griddle for cooking tortillas.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, se le presenta la necesidad de invertir más en el negocio de la agricultura y así adquirir más ganancias; este le ayudara a comprar semilla, abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, plaguicidas entre otros para preparar la tierra.
El préstamo anterior le ayudo a incrementar sus inventarios y obtener más ingresos; las circunstancias familiares han mejorado y las condiciones económicas asimismo.
texts.en: José needs to invest more in his agriculture business in order to acquire more income. This loan will help him to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide, among other things in order to prepare his land. His previous loan helped him to increase his inventory and obtain more income. His family circumstances have improved as well as his economic conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, herbicide, insecticide, and pesticide, among other things

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and works hard to support her family. She has been operating a fish vending business in the Philippines for 10 years and is now requesting a PHP 19500 loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell. In the future, Mercy would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen, age 37, is single and the mother of one kid, age 4. They both live in their own house that has electricity and piped water. 

For over three years, Hellen has operated a kindergarten school. Children from the neighborhood attend the school. She faces the major challenge of stiff competition in her business.

With this loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings, she wants to deploy more teachers in the school to accommodate the increasing number of children. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to deploy more teachers in the school to accommodate the increasing number of children.

loans.name: Chanthea

texts.en:
Chanthea, a 26-year-old married mother of a little son, lives in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province where, to cover the daily cost of living, she grows rice and raises two pigs. To supplement the family’s income, her husband ships firewood for resale. With eight years in her business, Chanthea is able to earn up to 14,600 KHR.

Having repaid her past loans, Chanthea is requesting her third one from Kiva partner VisionFund. For this cycle, she is seeking 3,000,000 KHR in order to buy a buffalo to support her farmland. She hopes that this purchase will help her eliminate her plowing fees.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo to support her farmland

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a responsible mother of two children. Her husband owns a construction business which is the only source of income for the family. Her husband wants to advertise his business; however, due to lack of finances, he finds it difficult. Therefore, Naseem has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to help her husband with the advertisement of his business so that he can easily get contracts. She is hopeful that the loan will be a productive one for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: for the advertisement of her husband's construction business to get contracts

loans.name: Kimyan

texts.en:
Kimyan, 32, is married and has three children, one of whom is still in school. The family lives in a rural village in the Battambang province’s Bovel district, Cambodia. 

For the last four years, she has been selling gasoline and spare parts, while her husband works as a motorbike repairer to make a living.  

Kimyan has already gone through one loan cycle with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan of 4,000,000KHR to buy more spare parts to resell. With this loan, Kimyan hopes to earn more income so as to improve her standard of living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy more spare parts to resell.

loans.name: Consolacion

texts.en:
Consolacion is 63 years old and married, with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Consolacion has a banana business in the Philippines. Consolacion has requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to purchase more bananas to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Consolacion has been in this business for 17 years and earns additional income from farming bananas. Consolacion would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Sohou's Group

texts.en: Sohou, age 30, is an inhabitant of Pursat province’s Kror Kor district. She has one child under her dependency. As a single and divorced mother, she has struggled to earn a living. She cultivates rice on one hectare of land and raises one pig. She is able to earn up to 10,800 KHR per day from the current business that she has done for a decade. Now, she is in a group of three to apply for a new loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has had two previous loans, which she used to support her business, and she has completely repaid those loans. This cycle, she and one of her co-borrowers are seeking loans of 700,000 KHR each, while the third member is applying for 300,000 KHR. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy potash and to pay transplanting fees. She hopes to increase her income in order to gradually improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy potash and to pay transplanting fees

loans.name: Mnyazi

texts.en:
Mnyazi is married with five school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees.

She has operated a goat-meat selling business for the past seven years. She sells the meat to town dwellers, passersby, and neighbors. She faces a major challenge of inflation in her business. 

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase seven goats for meat resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven goats for meat resale.

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en:
Michelle works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store in the Philippines. Michelle requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, soft drinks, etc. Michelle has been in this business for 15 years now, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store.

In the future, Michelle would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college. Michelle now resides in Puerto Princesa City, Palawan.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like soap, sugar, coffee, milk, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Chantha's Group

texts.en:
A villager from the Kampong Cham province’s Cheung Prey district, Chantha is 35 years old and married. She has one small child. The main source of her family’s income is from rice farming one hectare of farmland. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn a daily income of KHR34,000 to support her family, and she can save about KHR20,000 per day for future needs.

Chantha’s group has two members who have just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now she is leading her group to request a loan of KHR1,000,000 each. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy so as to make a living better and send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Hilario Jr.

texts.en:
Hilario Jr. is a 41-year-old married man and a father of three from Bohol, Philippines. He runs a sari-sari, or a small convenience store, selling a variety of goods and items to the people in his town. 

Hilario Jr. has been in the business for several years now. He is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, seasoning, and other cooking materials. Through this, he will be able to cater to more buyers and provide them with their needs.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods, noodles, soap, shampoo, seasoning and other cooking materials to sell.

loans.name: Kimsoeng

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Kampong Cham province’s Prey Chhor district, Kimsoeng is 49 years old, married, and has two children. She and her husband earn a living through working for others for a fee. Sometimes her husband works as a carpenter to better support the family. Having been in this business for eight years, she is able to earn about 14,000 KHR per day and save about 2,000 KHR each day for future needs. 

Kimsoeng is in her first loan cycle with VisionFund. She is asking for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR from VisionFund. Kimsoeng is going to use this loan to assist in paying for her child’s wedding. She hopes this loan will enable her child to have a warm family.

loans.use: To help pay for her child’s wedding

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Kimhong

texts.en:
Kimhong, 59, is married and has four children residing in Kampong Cham province. Currently, one of her children is still in her care as this son is still in school. She is able to earn up to 30,000 riels (KHR) per day rice cropping on one and a half hectares and working for a fee during her spare time.

This is the first loan for Kimhong with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She is seeking 1,800,000 KHR. She will use her loan to buy fertilizer, and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees. She hopes that she can make more income from her current business to sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to pay for plowing and transplanting fees

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Dy

texts.en:
Dy, a 30-year-old mother of one little kid, is a local farmer on one hectare of farmland. The rest of her family is living in Sampov Meas District of Pursat Province. She does rice cropping as her primary source of income, while her husband works at construction sites to supplement their income. She has been in business for four years, earning about 18,400 riels (KHR) per day. 

Dy is a third-time borrower with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. She has wisely utilized her past loan with success to support her business on time. Now, she is seeking 1,500,000 KHR in order to buy necessary materials to build her house. She hopes that she can own a decent house for her family – especially her kid – to live in.

loans.use: To buy necessary materials to build her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to finish the exterior of his home.

loans.name: Saida

texts.ru: Саида незамжняя молодая девушка. Ей 30 лет. Она живет вместе с родителями в Гиссарском районе, в центрально-западной части страны. У Саиды среднее образование. Она работает в хлопкоочистительном заводе. Саида еще и профессиональная портниха. В свободное от работы времени она вышивает для себя национальные платья и обучает учеников кройке и шитью. Сейчас Саида хотела бы открыть свое дело в этой сфере. Она запрашивает кредит для приобретения новой швейной машины для вышивки. Она собирается принимать заказы у себя дома и увеличить количество своих учеников. Саида надеется на успешное начало своей деятельности и в будущем планирует открыть собственный швейный артель.
texts.en: Saida is an unwed young woman, 30 years old.  She lives with her parents in the Gissar region, located in the central-western part of Tajikistan.  She has received a higher education and works in a cotton mill.  Saida also is a professional dressmaker.  In her free time, she embroiders the national dress and teaches students to cut and sew.  Now, Saida wants to open her own business in the industry.  She is asking for a loan to buy a new sewing machine for embroidery.  She plans to take orders, working from home, and to increase the number of students she has.  Saida is hoping for a successful beginning for her new endeavors and in the future, she plans to open her own sewing guild.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Dilmurod

texts.ru: Дилмурод 39 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Дилмурод женат на прекрасной женщине, и они живут счастливо. Дилмурод более 12 лет занимается услугой строителя. Он старается обеспечить семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами и поэтому тратит все свои деньги для семьи. Несколько дней назад его любимый брат обратился ему за деньгами в сумму 2200 сомони для покупки авиабилета, так как он хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию. Он не имеет постоянную работу в Таджикистане. Дилмурд не смог отказаться любимому брату и поэтому он обратился за займом, чтобы купить авиабилет брату. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en: Dilmurod is 39 years old, married and has 3 children.  His wife is a wonderful woman and they live together happily.  For more than 12 years, Dilmurod has worked in construction.  He tries to provide his family with all life's necessities and therefore spends all of his money on them.  A few days ago, his beloved brother came to him for money, asking for 2200 somoni to buy a plane ticket as he wants to travel to Russia.  His brother doesn't have dependable employment in Tajikistan.  Dilmurod could not refuse his brother so he's asking for a loan to pay for his ticket.  He awaits your kindness and assures he will repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy plane ticket for his brother who wants to go to Russia

loans.name: Simean's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a wooden house with her family in a rural village of the Ou Reang Ov district, Simean is 47 years, married, and has one child. She and her husband earn a living by fishing in the local area. In business for 27 years, she manages to earn about 14,000KHR per day and can save about 10,000KHR each day for future needs.

Leading a group of two, each seeking 500,000KHR, this will be Simean's first loan with VisionFund. She will use her portion to buy equipment for catching fish, hoping to increase her catch so as to improve the family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy materials for catching fish

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Umarjon

texts.ru: Умарджон более 10 лет занимается воспитанием и обучением детей в средней школе. Он образованный, умный и целеустремленный человек. Умарджон активно участвует в системе образования Республики Таджикистана. Он преподает историю и права человека. Умарджон профессионал своего дела. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Дети еще маленькие им до 3 лет. Его жена Наргиза тоже работает преподавателем в средней школе. Умарджон дополнительно занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, так как его зарплата не хватает для обеспечения семьи со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Умарджон и Наргиза накопили немного денег для ремонта дома, но их сбережения не хватает для покупки строительных материалов для проведения ремонта. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомон для покуки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: For more than 10 years, Umarjon has educated and trained children in high school.  He is an educated, smart and goal-oriented person.  Umarjon actively participates in the educational system of the Republic of Tajikistan.  He teaches history and human rights.  Umarjon is a professional in his field.  He is married and has 2 children.  His kids are still little--they're both under 3 years old.  His wife, Nargiza, also works as a teacher at a high school.  Additionally, Umarjon farms since his salary isn't enough to provide his family with all necessities.  He and Nargiza have saved a bit of money to make repairs to their home but they do not have enough savings to buy building materials.  Umarjon is asking for a loan of 3,000 somoni to buy these construction materials.  He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials to repair his house

loans.name: Mahmadyor

texts.ru: Дом, где живет  Махмадёр и его семья  не отвечает стандартам жилья и он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом. Ему 37 лет, он женат и на воспитании имеет  3 детей. Его жена Инобатхон домохозяйка и занимается воспитанием детей. Детям от 3 до 9 лет. Старшие дети учатся в средней школе и всегда просят родителей отремонтировать их дом, но его зарплата не хватает для ремонта дома. Он должен отремонтировать все комнаты и готовить дом до зимы, так как в Таджикистане зима довольно холодная и дом должен быть удобным для проведения зимы. Из-за не удобства дома, у детей всегда насморк зимой. Махмадёр запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 долларов США для покупки строительных материалов для ремонта дома.  Махмадёр  и его дети ждут вашу доброту.
texts.en: The home in which Mahmadyor and his family live does not meet housing standards and he urgently needs to make renovations.  Mahmadyor is 37 years old, married and has 3 children.  His wife, Inobatjon, is a homemaker and spends her time raising the children--aged 3 to 9.  The older children attend school and always ask their parents to repair their home.  Unfortunately, their salary doesn't allow it.  Mahmadyor must renovate all rooms and prepare the structure for winter since it is a very cold time in Tajikistan, and a home should be comfortable throughout the season.  Because of the building's shortcomings, the children are often cold.  Mahmadyor is asking for a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials for the project.  He and his children await your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials to makes badly needed repairs to his home.

loans.name: Sreymom

texts.en:
A 39-year-old mother of three children, Sreymom resides in a rural village of Kampong Cham Province’s Tbaung Khmum District in Cambodia. Her husband works in a rubber field, which he has been doing for seventeen years.  

Sreymom earns about 35,000 KHR from her business daily to meet her family’s needs. She is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy wood to renovate her old house. This is her first microloan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She hopes that this loan will helped her repair her house so she can improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy wood to renovate her old house

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen works hard to support her family. Helen is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Helen requested a PHP 14,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Helen has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Taingly's Group

texts.en: Taingly, 44 years old and a villager in the Kror Kor district of Pursat Province, is married and has five children. The rest of her family depends on pig raising and two hectares of rice farming, which has returned her about 16,000 KHR per day. She has been involved in the current businesses for 12 years. This is not the first loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She feels empowered that she can uplift her living status at a good pace,  especially by providing decent food for her kids. She has fully repaid her past loan. Now, she has joined a group of three and she is the leader. The total amount of her group's loan is 2,800,000 KHR. As for Taingly, she will spend her loan portion to buy more pigs to raise and pig feed. She hopes to fatten her pigs in a healthy way so she can make more income.

loans.use: to buy more pigs to raise and pig feed

loans.name: Amon

texts.en:
Amon still sells tomatoes, and the business is doing well. He is grateful to KADET LTD for supporting him financially, a gesture that has boosted his business to its present level. He has started a motorcycle transport business, to supplement his income. He now earns a monthly income of KES 15,000. 

He is requesting another business loan, which he will use to purchase tomatoes, in bulk, to supply to his growing number of customers. He will use the proceeds from the business to invest for his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, in bulk, to sell to his customers

loans.name: Leang's Group

texts.en:
Leang, 27, a young mother of three children, is from Pursat Province. She is a rice farmer and her husband is a paid worker. 

Leang's farming business, which she has been operating for eight years, allows her to earn 16,800 KHR per day. She is now requesting a loan of 1,400,000 KHR. After successfully repaying two past loans, Leang feels confident that she can sustain her business. As the group leader, Leang will use her loan portion to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy season rice. She hopes to grow her crop seasonably and make a high profit.

Leang leads a loan group of three women. They are applying for a new loan with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. The other two members of her loan group are requesting 1,000,000 KHR each.

loans.use: to buy an additional plot of farmland to grow rainy season rice

loans.name: Yen

texts.en:
Yen, 61, is a Cambodian citizen from a rural village located in the Kampong Cham Province’s Tbaung Khmum District. She is widowed with three children. 

For the last 30 years, Yen has been planting cassava to support her family. With her current business, she can earn about 26,000 KHR per day and can save about 10,000 KHR per day for future needs.

Yen is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava plots. She hopes that her rice will grow plentifully so she can sell it for a good price and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her cassava plots

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Benedeta

texts.en:
Benedeta is a married woman and has three children. She lives owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past eight years, she has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan that she is requesting of KSHS 15,000, she wants to purchase more stock of wheat, maize, beans and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase wheat, maize, beans and rice to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora is 40 years old and married with seven children.

Nora works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy stocks to sell like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, spices, soap, etc..

Nora has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish.

Nora aspires to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy stocks to sell like soap, soft drinks, canned goods, spices, soap, etc.

loans.name: Saroeurn's Group

texts.en:
Saroeurn is a widow and mother of six children, is about 50 years old, and resides in Pursat Province.  Her primary sources of income are grocery selling and rice farming. She has been doing this work for over 10 years.

This loan will be her fifth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has managed to support her business on time and provide sufficient food for her kids, and she has completely repaid her previous loan.  Now in a group of four, she is the leader. She and two of her joint members are seeking 1,400,000 KHR each, whereas the remaining member is applying for 500,000 KHR. As the group leader, Saroeurn will spend her loan portion to buy more grocery items to resell. She hopes this loan will replenish her business on time and return her more income.

loans.use: To buy more grocery items to resell

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
Ry, 46, lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district. She is a married mother of five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Her family’s income is from leasing a 5-hectare rice paddy farm. She has been in this business for 28 years to make a living. From the current business, Ry can earn about KHR 25,000 per day and manages to save about KHR10,000 per day for future needs.

Ry is just with VisionFund this cycle while the other members have been with VisionFund for two to four cycles. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to earn more income from her rice paddy to make a living better and keep her children in school

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence, 54, is a married woman. She has five kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Florence operates a fruit and vegetable stall and sells produce at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces the challenge of high transportation costs.

With the 50,000 KES loan, Florence plans to purchase sacks of fruit, including oranges and bananas, and green vegetables to resell. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a retail shop in the future.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fruit, including oranges and bananas, and green vegetables to resell

loans.name: Chay's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a village of Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Chay is aged 51 years and married. She has two children, one of whom is dependent and still in school. For more than ten years, she and her husband have been farming rice as the primary source of their family’s income. They can earn about KHR 25,000 per day, and they manage to save about KHR 13,000 each day, for future needs.

Chay has been with VisionFund for one previous loan cycle. Chay completely paid back the past loan, which helped her to better support her family with enough food. Now she is leading her group to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion of the loan funds to buy fertilizer for her farmland. She hopes to make a greater crop yield, so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Nove

texts.en:
Nove is 48 years old, married and has three children who are in school. 

Nove is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Nove requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nove has been in business for five years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nove would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jerson

texts.en: Jerson earns a living through his sari-sari (retail store) business. He has been in this business for more than five years now. Jerson is asking for a loan to buy additional stocks of soap, shampoo, canned goods, seasonings, cooking ingredients, and other items to sell. With this loan, Jerson will be able to improve his business and make it a success. Moreover, he wants to save money to reinvest in his business and pay the future educational expenses of his two young children.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, shampoo, canned goods, seasonings, cooking ingredients, and other items to sell

loans.name: Precilla

texts.en: As a married parent of six children, Precilla works hard to support her family. She has a dried fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transportation and buying and selling meat. Precilla is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy stock of assorted dried fish to sell. Precilla has been sustaining her business activities through her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy stock of assorted dried fish to sell

loans.name: Purita

texts.en: As a married parent of eight children, Purita works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising livestock.  Purita is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries items like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell. Purita has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business and secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items like soap, milk, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. to sell

loans.name: Saram's Group

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in Battambang province’s Phnom Proek district, Saram is 30 years old and married. She has three dependent children, two of whom are still in school. She and her husband grow corn and cassava. Sometimes they work for others for a fee. She has been in this business for eight years, earning about KHR 36,000 per day and is able to save about KHR 15,000 each day for future needs. 

Saram’s group is composed of two members who are both female, and this is her first microloan with VisionFund. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to obtain more income from her growing business to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticides for her farmland

loans.name: Ma. Jennifer

texts.en:
Ma. Jennifer is a married woman with one child. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Ma. Jennifer is 37 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ma. Jennifer has a general store business in the Philippines. Ma. Jennifer requested a PHP 19000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries .

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her general store business.

Ma. Jennifer has been in this business for 7 years. Ma. Jennifer would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store, such as shampoo, vinegar, cooking oil, noodles and other groceries

loans.name: Shabana's Group

texts.en:
Shabana is 55-year-old housewife. She lives in Lahore, Pakistan. She is the mother of four children. 

Her husband owns small restaurant in the market that is the only source of income for the family. He wants to offer more variety to his customers, which will hopefully help him increase his net income and savings. However, due to a lack of funds, it is difficult for him to purchase products that he needs to cook a variety of delicious dishes. 

Shabana is a member of seven-person loan group. The group has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan. Shabana will use her loan to help her husband purchase a variety of food products including rice, vegetables, meat, chicken, yougurt, and salt. The loan will also be used to purchase furniture to enhance the restaurant's seating arrangement. Shabana's husband wants to grow his business in the future with his profits. 

Shabana is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of food products and furniture for her husband's restaurant.

loans.name: Sem

texts.en:
Sem lives in a rural village of the Bovel district of Battambang province, Cambodia. He is 33 years old and married with four children, two of whom are still in school in the local area. To support his family, he has been growing cassava for six years. The current business earns him about 43,000 KHR per day, and he can afford to save 20,000 KHR each day after expenses. 

Sem is a first-cycle client with VisionFund. He is asking for a loan of 1,500,000 KHR to buy pesticides, fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland; he will also spend a portion of the money on labor for plowing the field. With this loan, Sem hopes to make more healthy rice so he can increase his family’s income and make a better living.

loans.use: To buy pesticides, fertilizers and rice seeds for his farmland

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en: Rebecca works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motrorcycle. Rebecca has been in this business for 5 years now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and other materials for the maintenance of her motrorcycle

loans.name: Oneza

texts.en:
Oneza is 62 years old. He lives in a small village in the Akhmeta District with his wife and two children. Oneza requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for his family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

Oneza has a grocery shop and works with his wife there. Additionally, he has 2 calves and after they are grown his wife will produce dairy products to sell.

Oneza has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Oneza will purchase a stock of groceries for his grocery shop. After the stock is purchased, he will be able to offer his clients more assortments of products and thus increase his sales, which will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is still running his two businesses: shopkeeper and motorcycle transport. He is thankful to KADET and KIVA for lending him money to boost his businesses. 

He is applying for another loan to buy another motorcycle so that he can meet the demand of his increasing customers. He hopes to buy many motorcycles in order to create employment for the many jobless youths in his area.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is 37 years old, married with 1 child. She lives in Calamba, Misamis Occidental. She owns and operates a bakery in the local community to earn a living. She has been in her business for over 5 years and earns 10,000 PHP every month. She has joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, she wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients

loans.name: Ashraf

texts.en:
Ashraf is a 26-year-old man. He lives in Lahore, Pakistan. He is a responsible father of one daughter. He loves his family a lot and wishes to provide all facilities for his family. He owns a small boutique in the area, which is the only source of income for the family. His shop is situated in a remote area where he is not getting a good profit so he is planning to sell his dresses in different areas of Lahore so that he can get a good amount of profit. 

Ashraf has requested a loan of 150,000 PKR from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for his boutique. He will purchase a variety of threads, clothes, colorful laces, beads, and buttons for stitching beautiful and attractive ladies dresses. He hopes that the loan will be productive for his business. He is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of threads, clothes, colourful laces, beads, buttons for stitching ladies dresses to sell.

loans.name: Luciana

texts.en: Luciana is a merchant from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business selling various goods and items to the people in her area. Luciana is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, vinegar, food seasoning and others. With this, she will be able to augment her store and attract more buyers. In the future, Luciana hopes to expand her business so that it will be a stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, chips and snack foods, soap and toiletries, vinegar, food seasoning and other items

loans.name: Rosario

texts.en:
Rosario is 35 years old and married with four children; three of whom are in school. Rosario works very hard to provide for them.

Rosario sells charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of charcoal.

Rosario has been in this business for 5 years.

In the future Rosario would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Yosinjon

texts.ru: Ёсинджону 40 лет. Он добрый, трудолюбивый человек, который упорно работает для реализации своих планов. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 1 сына. Ёсинджон более 22 года занимается производством и реализации лепешки. Он имеет свой цех, который находится в его доме. Ёсинджон имеет 2 помощников. Он производит 260-380 штук лепешек в день. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов, которые покупают его лепешки и продают на местном рынке. Он является повторным клиентом и кредитуется 4 цикл. Ёсинджон имеет хорошую репутацию и кредитную историю. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони для покупки муки. Он хочет развевать бизнес, путем производства больше лепешки. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Yosinjon is 40 years old. He is a kind and hard-working who works hard to make his plans a reality. He is married and raising one son. For over 22 years, Yosinjon has been baking flatbread for sale. He has his own bakery in his home. Yosinjon  has two assistants. He produces between 260 and 380  flatbreads per day. He has his loyal customers who buy his flatbreads and resell them at the local market. He has been our client in the past, and this is his fourth loan cycle. Yosinjon has a good reputation and credit history. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7,000 TJS to buy flour. He would like to develop his business by increasing his production volume. He is counting on your kindness and hoping for your compassion.

loans.use: to buy flour for baking.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a grocery store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from a computer shop.

Rosalinda is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of groceries like soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc. for her grocery store business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her grocery store business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries like soap, shampoo, milk, noodles, canned goods, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 39 years old, married to Nebati and a mother of four children. She sells clothes in Ruaka in the outskirts of Kiambu town. She has been in this business for three years now and gets a monthly income of 10,000 shillings.

This will be Rose's second loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to buy more stock of clothes to sell. In future she wants to be a successful business lady and also improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes.

loans.name: Melchora

texts.en: Melchora is a 38-year-old married woman and a mother of two children from Bohol, Philippines. She runs a sari-sari or variety store business as a source of income. Melchora is asking for a loan to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, shampoo, soda and coffee, seasonings and other items. With more stock in her store, she will be able to cater to the needs of her buyers and increase her sales and income. Melchora believes that hard work and perseverance is necessary to succeed in life. She wants to continue supporting the schooling of her children.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell like canned goods, candies, soap, shampoo, soda and coffee, seasonings and other items

loans.name: Petrona

texts.es:
Petrona se dedica a la crianza de ganado vacuno para la producción de leche la cual vende a una de las Plantas Industrializadoras de Leche. Ella vive con  uno de sus hijos el cual ya tiene su respectiva familia, en su casa propia ubicada en la comunidad de Nina Chiri, del Sector Laja de La provincia Los Andes del Departamento de La Paz a una hora de distancia  de la ciudad de La Paz cuenta con  algunas cabezas de ganado de raza mejorada las cuales requieren mejor cuidado dada las condiciones climatológicas del sector.

El crédito lo requiere para comprar material de construcción: cemento, ladrillos, etc. Así podrá  refaccionar el establo para ganado, por lo tanto mejorar su producción, conservando la buena salud de sus vacas.

El sueño de Petrona  es incrementar sus cabezas de ganado, precautelando la buena salud de ellos.

Es la cuarta vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la segunda  vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Petrona raises dairy cattle to produce milk. She sells it in one of the milk industrialized plants. She lives with one of her children, who has his own family, in her house located in the community of Nina Chiri, in the Laja sector of the province of Los Andes, department of La Paz. It's an hour from the city of La Paz. She has some heads of pure bred cattle. They need better care, given the weather conditions in the area.

She needs the loan to buy construction materials such as cement, bricks, etc. This way, she can repair the cattle stable and thus improve her production, keeping them in good health. 

Petrona's dream is to increase her heads of cattle, caring for their good health. 

This is the fourth time she has asked for a loan from IMPRO and the second time with KIVA.

loans.use: to buy cement and  bricks to repair the stable so her dairy cows can be in good health and therefore have better milk production.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en: Luz earns a living through her sari-sari, or convenience store, business. She sells foods and other goods to the people in her area in Bohol, Philippines. Luz needs a loan for the expansion of her business. She is asking for a loan to buy more stock to sell like soda and beverages, chips and snack foods, soap, detergents, shampoo and other items. Luz is optimistic that this loan could help her improve her income and earnings.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soda and beverages, chips and snack foods, soap, detergents, shampoo and other items.

loans.name: Twumvire Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Twumvire est composé de 39 femmes et 4 hommes.Sur la photo Triphonie, Violette,Pascasie, et Judith  étaient empêchées le jour de l'octroi du crédit.Elles ont été représentées par leurs maris respectifs:Berchmans, Janvier, Rémy, Léopold.

Sicaire est le chef du groupe et   habite à Kayanza. Il  a  43 ans et est marié à Béatrice, une cultivatrice. Ensemble ils ont  7 enfants âgés de 1 à 16 ans, dont 5 étudient.

Il est tailleur depuis 26 ans et fait le commerce des culottes qu'il obtient  à partir de la transformation des habits d'occasion.

Il est à son  dixième  crédit à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’il obtient, il  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup d'habits à transformer en culottes à vendre, pour gagner plus. 

Dans les prochaines années, il voudrait  faire le commerce de boutique et voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
The Twumvire group is made up of 39 women and 4 men. Triphonie, Violette, Pascasie, and Judith were unable to make it for the photo on the day they got their loan, so they are represented by their respective husbands: Berchmans, Janvier, Remy, and Leopold.

Sicaire is the head of the group and lives in Kayanza. He is 43 years old and married to Beatrice, who is a farmer. Together they have seven children, aged from 1 to 16 years old. Five of the children go to school. Sicaire has been a tailor for 26 years and sells pants that he makes out of clothing. He is on his 10th loan from Turame. With this Kiva loan, he is going to increase his capital to buy many clothes, which he will make into pants and then resell, allowing him to earn more. In the coming years, Sicaire would like to sell [his clothes] in a shop and see his children go to school.

loans.use: to buy clothing

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is a young lady of 35 years, married to Robert and a mother of three children. She sells home products and jackets, shoes, etc. She has been in this business for 12 years now and gets a monthly income of 27,000 KES.

This will be Teresa's third loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the entire loan to pay school fees for one of her children who is in high school. She wants to open another shop in the future.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
El es un joven de 20 años desde su infancia le ha gustado todo lo referente a las ciencias de la salud y escogió la enfermería ya que es una rama polifacética y la cual va muy relacionada con el cuidado y progreso de los pacientes.
Ve a la institución como una plataforma para poder desarrollar mis diferentes habilidades y llegar hacer un buen profesional ética mente como intelectualmente, vive con su madre, el estaba pagando su semestre, pero des-afortunadamente se encuentra desempleado y le ha sido complicado poder cumplir con el pago oportuno de dicho semestre ya que su madre con mucho esfuerzo le está ayudando a pagarlos porque no quiere que abandone sus estudios ya que quiere lo mejor para él.
Este joven Quisiera poder terminar su carrera para así poder desempeñarse en lo que le gusta hacer que es la enfermería y así poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su madre y poder seguir superándose día a día y en un futuro no muy lejano estudiar jefe de enfermería que es su meta y su sueño, él es una persona muy responsable dedicada apasionada por lo que le gusta hacer.
Su ayuda la ve como una oportunidad de seguir estudiando y seguir superándose y poder llegar a su meta a corto plazo que es graduarse como auxiliar de enfermería y que su madre sepa que todo este esfuerzo de parte de ella y del dio resultados y que sienta orgullosa de ser su hijo.
texts.en:
Carlos Andres is 20 years old, and ever since a very young age he has liked all things related to the health sciences. He chose nursing because it is a diverse field and and closely related to the care and progress of patients. 

He sees the institution as a platform for developing his different skills and becoming a good, ethical, and intellectual professional. He lives with his mother. He was paying his own tuition, but unfortunately he is currently unemployed, which has made making his semester payments difficult. His mother, through tremendous effort, has been helping him pay tuition because she wants the best for him and does not want him to abandon his studies.

This young man had wanted to finish his career track so he could begin working doing what he loves, which is nursing. This would allow him to provide for a better quality of life for his mother, to continue getting head day by day, and, in a not too distant future, to study nursing management, which is his goal and his dream. He is a responsible and dedicated person who is passionate about what he wants to do.

He sees your assistance as an opportunity to continue studying, to continue getting ahead, and to be able to achieve his short-term goal of graduating as a nurse's assistant. He also wants his mother to know that all of this effort on her part has shown results and that he feels proud to be her son.

loans.use: to finish nursing school.

loans.name: Rosma

texts.en:
Rosma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business buying and selling cultured pearls in the Philippines.

Rosma requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of cultured pearls to sell.

Rosma has been in this business for one year now. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of cultured pearls to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
She is a 52-year-old woman from Eregi location in Vihiga County. She is married to Earnest, who is a businessman and offers support in their family. They have grown-up children and grandchildren.

She is a small-scale farmer where she grows varieties of foodstuffs. She has been doing this for the last 15 years and makes a monthly income of KES 7,000. 

She has applied for her second loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase seeds and fertilizers for her farm. She will use the anticipated profit to start dairy farming as a new business. She has a dream of starting a dairy farm and supporting her grandchildren.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Herminia

texts.es:
Herminia es casada pero su esposo trabaja en Chile desempeñando las funciones de chofer, tiene dos hijos los cuales están en etapa escolar, viven en casa propia, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona  El Kenko de la ciudad de El Alto.
Ella estudio hasta el nivel secundario y se dedica a la crianza de ganado y además es productora lechera.
El crédito lo requiere para  el mejoramiento de su establo; construirá un establo atemperado, lo que mejorará la producción de leche.

Es la primera  vez que solicita crédito junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Herminia is married but her husband works in Chile as a driver. She has two children who are school aged.  She lives in a home she owns, located in the El Kenko,  in the city of El Alto.

She went to school up to the secondary level and works raising cattle and in milk production. She needs the loan to do some improvements on her stable. She will build a climate controlled stable, which will help milk production. 

This is the first time she has asked for a loan with IMPRO and with KIVA.

loans.use: to build a climate controlled stable for her dairy cows and in this way improve milk production.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. She earns more income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF to buy items to sell like noodles, coffee, milk, soap, spices, etc. for her general store business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like noodles, coffee, milk, soap, spices, etc.

loans.name: Kweeba Development Association Group

texts.en:
Jesca is a 40-year-old resident of Mutundwe and a divorced mother of four children. She, therefore, has a very big responsibility of taking care of her children by providing them with education, shelter, clothing and medical care.

She operates a small retail shop that she started with the purpose of meeting her daily needs like taking care of her children.  She has been in this business for 10 years and has a dream of setting up a wholesale shop to increase her income and productivity in the near future. Jesca's major challenge is lack of enough capital to purchase more stock. She, therefore, needs a loan for buying more commodities for the shop. Jesca's neighbors commented that she’s a hardworking and dedicated woman.

In the photo are 10 members of the group and the loan officer at the front in a red shirt.

loans.use: To buy stock for her retail shop

loans.name: Maïmouna

texts.fr:
Madame   Maïmouna est âgée de 44 ans, mariée et mère de 2 enfants.  Elle  vit  dans une famille nucléaire avec son mari et ses enfants  au  quartier Somono de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença tôt  à faire le commerce  auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments et céréales. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à ses côtés, elle finit par évoluer seul pour faire le commerce de céréales, elle mène cette activité depuis 7 ans et jouit d’une grande expérience et clientèle. 
Dans le souci de faire de face à la demande clientèle, elle a fait   recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 84 mois. Après 4 prêts solidaires et 5 prêts individuels tous correctement  remboursés, elle est à son 6ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser   pour acheter 1 tonne de riz. Elle s’approvisionne à Niono, Siribala et Dougabougou.  Madame Maïmouna  vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes. Elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 90.000 FCFA, qui lui permet de pérenniser son activité. Son ambition est  de construire une maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Maimouna is 44 years old, married and the mother of two. She lives in a nuclear family with her husband and children in the Somono district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali).

Not having attended school for social reasons, she began working as a vendor alongside her mother, who used to sell condiments and cereals. After several years of this apprenticeship, she launched her own business selling cereals. She has been in this business for seven years and has plenty of experience and many customers.

With the goal of meeting customer demand, she reached out to Soro Yiriwaso, with which she has been collaborating for 84 months. After four solidarity loans and five individual loans, all duly reimbursed, she is now on her sixth individual loan, intended for purchasing one ton [2205 lbs] of rice. She stocks up in Niono, Siribala and Dougabougou. Mrs. Maimouna sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed of both men and women. She plans to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will allow her to stabilize her business. Her goal is to build a house.

loans.use: to buy rice.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Violeta works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. 

Violeta is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Violeta has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Virgita

texts.en:
Virgita is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Three of her children are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She has a fishing business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for eight years.

Virgita requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan to buy fishing net and other fishing gear, for her business. In the future, Virgita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and other fishing gear for her business

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: Don Reynaldo, un hombre trabajador que lucha por su familia para que no le falte lo necesario en la casa el pan diario, con la ayuda de su esposa quien vende productos varios, ambos apoyan a sus hijos menores quienes estudian y espera logren culminar una carrera cada uno de ellos y para poder lograrlo sale a por las calles a rebuscar chatarras para vender, es por eso el motivo de este crédito para continuar invirtiendo en su pequeño negocio que es su único medio de ingresos.
texts.en: Reynaldo is a hardworking man who fights for his family so they will lack for nothing when it comes to the daily bread. With the help of his wife, who sells different products, they support their minor children who go to school and who hope to have college degrees. in order to do this, each of them goes out to the streets looking for scrap metal to sell. That is why he is asking for this loan, to keep investing in his small business which is his only source of income.

loans.use: to buy scrap metal.

loans.name: Melencia

texts.en:
Melencia is a 46-year-old married woman from Alicia, Bohol. She is a mother of five school-age children. 

Melencia operates a barbershop in her place. This is the source of her income. Melencia is applying for a loan to buy additional materials for her shop like scissors, powder, hairstyling cream and other materials.  

In the future, Melencia hopes to make her business successful and sustainable. She dreams of experiencing a more comfortable life and seeing her children as successful professionals someday.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her shop like scissors, powder, hairstyling cream and other materials.

loans.name: Ritz Malow

texts.en:
Ritz Malow is 29 years old and single with one child. She lives at Calamba, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. 

Ritz Malow owns and operates farmland, planting and harvesting bananas for sale to earn a living. She has been in this business for five years. She earns PHP 15,000 from the business every month. 

She requested a loan of PHP 25,000 to purchase fertilizer, such as manure. She joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. 

In the future, Ritz Malow wants to make improvements to her house and to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Murtaz

texts.en:
Murtaz is 37 years old. He lives in the small village of Telavi District with his parents, wife and two children. Murtaz requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is from agricultural activities. In particular, they have a plot of agricultural land, where maize is grown. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. It is hardly enough for food for the family. According to Credo estimations the family belongs to the subsistence poor category. 

Murtaz requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Murtaz has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages the provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With his credit Murtaz will purchase a minibus. After purchasing a minibus he will begin trading with groceries. This will increase the income of his family. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva Start-up loan will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a minibus and start trading with groceries

loans.name: Michelle

texts.en: Michelle earns a living through her food-vending business, selling home-cooked snack foods to the people in her area. Michelle works hard to support her husband in meeting the needs of the family especially for the schooling of their children. As of now, she is asking for a loan to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, milk, and cooking oil. Through this, she will be able to cook and sell more thus augmenting her sales and income. In the future, Michelle hopes to make her business a success. Furthermore, it is her dream to support and send her children to school someday for a better education.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her food vending business like flour, sugar, milk, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael sells secondhand clothes in Nakuru town and also has a mining business. He has applied for his third loan from KADET LTD after paying his previous loan in a timely manner. He intends to buy fabric materials used in making clothes for his business with the loan amount.

He hopes to open a boutique in Nakuru in the near future.

loans.use: to buy materials for his clothing business.

loans.name: Mwambiro

texts.en:
Mwambiro, aged 26 years, is a married woman with three children all under her care. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and clothing. 

Mwambiro operates a vegetable and fruit selling business. Her major goal is to become a leading fruit vending business in the area to raise her profits.

For that reason with the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaws. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables and sacks of fruits such as oranges, mangoes, watermelons and pawpaws.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
