Hace 4 años que Ani decidió por tener su propio negocio donde vende productos de la canasta básica familiar como granos básicos, pan, azúcar, manteca, pastillas, productos enlatados, huevos, churros, refrescos, productos de limpieza, etc. Ella ha invertido en su negocio para tenerlo estable, actualmente esta solicitando un tercer préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, manteca, pan y otros para mejorar el servicio al cliente e incrementar el inventario. Su sueño es tener un negocio grande y ayudar a sus hijos con una buena educación.
texts.en:
Ani, age 42, is a single mother with two children. She lives in a neighborhood in Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara.

Four years ago, Ani decided to start her own business of selling basic household products such as grains, bread, sugar, lard, medicines, canned goods, eggs, snack foods, soft drinks, cleaning products, and other items. She has invested in her business so that it will remain stable.

Ani is currently requesting her third loan in the amount of 12,000 HNL so that she can buy basic grains, sugar, lard, bread, and other products in order to improve service to her customers and to increase her inventory. Her dream is to have a large business so that she can help her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, sugar, lard, bread, and other products.

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
Jose Luis, es casado y tiene dos hijos que están en etapa escolar, viven en una habitación en anticretico, la casa se  encuentra ubicada en la zona Llojeta de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente trabaja de forma independiente realizando instalaciones eléctricas y telefónicas por más de ocho o diez horas al día y tampoco cuenta con el seguro médico que debería ya que el trabajo que realiza es muy peligroso  y que con lo poco que gana debe cubrir los gastos de alimentación, educación y pago de servicios básicos de su familia.
El crédito lo necesita para comprar una enciclopedia para sus hijos ya que la necesitan para sus estudios, y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprarlo.
El sueño de Jose Luis, es mejorar sus ingresos y poder adquirir una casa en anticretico más grande para dar más seguridad y comodidad a su familia
Es la quinta vez que solicita crédito en IMPRO y la segunda vez junto a KIVA.
texts.en:
Jose Luis is married and has two children who are in school.  They live in a home under an "anticrético" (anticresis) arrangement.  The house is located in the Llojeta zone of the city of La Paz.  He currently works independently doing electrical and telephone installations.  He does this work for over 8 to 10 hours a day.  He does not have any medical insurance, which he should, since the work he does is very dangerous and with the little that he earns he needs to cover the food, education, and basic services expenses for his family. 

He needs this loan to purchase an encyclopedia for his children who need it for their studies.  He does not have the money to buy it.  Jose Luis dreams of improving his income and being able to acquire a larger home in anticresis in order to be able to provide greater security and comfort to his family.  This is the fifth time he has requested a loan with IMPRO, and the second with KIVA.

loans.use: to purchase an encyclopedia for his children who are in school.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a car and merchandise.

loans.name: Gafurjon

texts.ru: Гафурджону 32 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Детям 1, 4 и 7 лет. Его жена очень добрая и чистоплотная женщина. Она домохозяйка и не имеет источника дохода. Гафурджон является единственным кормильцем в семье. Он более 8 лет занимается услугой мастера по ремонту дома. Он имеет «золотые руки» и является отличным строителем. Он строит красивые дома, но сам живет в старом доме, так как не имеет денег для покупки дома. В течение многих лет он сделал сбережения, целью того, что купит дом. Он нашел подходящий дом, которого очень хочет купить, но у него не хватает деньги. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 12500 сомони для покупки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту и обещает погасить займ во время.
texts.en:
Gafurjon is 32 years old. He is married and raising three children. His children are 1, 4 and 7 years old. His wife is a very good woman concerned with cleanliness. She is a housewife and does not have a source of income. Gafurjon is the sole supporter of the family. 

For more than eight years Gafurjon has provided a carpenter service, refurbishing houses. He has "golden hands" and is an excellent builder. He builds beautiful houses, but lives in an old house himself, as he does not have enough money to purchase a new house. For a period of many years he saved money with the aim to purchase a house. 

Gafurjon found an appropriate house, which he would very much like to purchase, but he does not have enough money. He requests a loan in the amount of 12,500 somoni for the purchase of a house. He awaits your kindness and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To buy a house

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has 5 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells doughnuts in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 5 years.

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of flour, sugar, and cooking oil, which will help improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase flour, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ekua is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Kenkey’ (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling ‘Kenkey’ in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 16 years.

Ekua is married and has 5 children. Her husband works as a fireman. The proceeds from her ‘Kenkey’ business normally goes towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pays their children’s school fees. Ekua will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize to make and sell more Kenkey. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ekua plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Sithorn's Group

texts.en: Sithorn, 45, is a single man residing in Pursat Province. He depends solely on a single source of income, a pig-raising business. The 10 years he has spent in the current business has returned him about 12,300 KHR per day. This is not his first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. He has received two loans already and has successfully repaid his previous loan, which supported his business on time and helped him to get decent food. Now, he is leading a group of two to apply for a new loan. He is asking for 1,000,000 KHR while his fellow member is applying for 200,000 KHR. As the leader, he will spend his entire portion to buy more pigs as well as feed for them. He hopes to triple his income and better his living.

loans.use: To buy more pigs and feed

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mercy is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling bowls and plastic buckets in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 6 years.

Mercy is married and has 8 children. Her husband works for the lottery. The proceeds from her business go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mercy will use the loan to purchase more bowls and plastic buckets, which will help improve overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mercy plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more bowls and plastic buckets for sale

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Even though Victoria grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from aspiring a better life for her and her family. Currently, Victoria is an entrepreneur. She prepares and sells ‘Gari’ (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava). She primarily sells her ‘Gari’ in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 1 year ago. 

Victoria uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 5 children. Victoria has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her ‘Gari’, however she is unable to meet their needs due to a limited capacity. She hopes to use her loan to purchase more cassava, therefore helping her to prepare more of her tasty ‘Gari’.  With the new profits from her expanded business, Victoria wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more cassava

loans.name: Tanzila

texts.en:
Ms. Tanzila is a 27-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. She is been in the business of stitching clothes for a period of about of five years. She started her business to provide financial support to her husband in meeting the educational needs of her children. 

Tanzila stitches for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet with the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of Rs 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. 

She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of thread in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons. This will create a means of increasing revenues, so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. 

She is in her third loan cycle and is thankful to Kashf for its tremendous support. Tanzila aspires to save money to build her own house, as now she is living on rent.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads in different colors and packs of laces, zippers and buttons.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: Hilda   de 22 años de edad,  soltera y sin hijos, es un agradable estudiante de la facultad de Ciencias De La Comunicación, estudia mucho para alcanzar sus metas en la vida. Con la ayuda de sus padres  Hilda  ha sabido salir adelante estudiar mucho y  así culminar sus estudios y así poder ser  exitosa en la vida. Con el préstamo otorgado ella podrá realizar los pagos de su matrícula universitaria y la compra de útiles de estudio que necesita. Hilda   se encuentra muy agradecida  por la ayuda brindada y se despide con un fuerte abrazo ah Kiva y diciéndoles que cumplirá la promesa de salir adelante.
texts.en:
Hilda, 22, is single and does not have any children. She is a pleasant student of the Faculty of Communication Sciences. She studies a lot to achieve her goals in life. With her parent's help, Hilda has know how to get ahead, studying a lot, in order to  complete her studies and therein be successful in life. 

With the loan given, Hilda will be able to pay for her university inscription fees and buy the study materials she requires. She is very grateful for the help given, and she signs off with a big hug for Kiva, saying that she will fulfil her promise of getting ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy study materials.

loans.name: Phoebe

texts.en:
Phoebe, 41, is a single mother from Kisumu City. Her two children are 21 and 13 years-old.

She has a Beauty Salon in Kisumu City within the Central Business District (CBD). She has been running this business for the last 10 years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She has applied for her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon. She will use the anticipated profit to grow her business.

She has a dream of opening a big business so as to support her family.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics for her beauty salon

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Even though Comfort grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. 

Currently, Comfort is an entrepreneur. She sells charcoal in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 4 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their 5 children. 

Comfort has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. She is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more charcoal to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Comfort wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell

loans.name: Hanifah's Group

texts.en:
Hanifah's group is comprised of 2 hard working women. Hanifah is 16 and lives in the town of Luwero in Uganda. For the past 2 years, Hanifah has been working hard to manage her salon, where she does hair dressing. 

To help expand her business, Hanifah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy bigger dryers and other machines that will be used for hair styling. These machines will help Hanifah to generate greater profits and to provide for her family's basic needs. Hanifah hopes that in the future she will be able to go back to school. 

Hanifah is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more dryers and other machines that will be used for hair styling

loans.name: Mary  (Esi Egyima)

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mary is an entrepreneur. 

She prepares and sells Kenkey (a traditional Ghanaian dish made from corn dough and is wrapped in banana leaves). She can be found selling Kenkey in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 20 years. 

Mary is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her Kenkey business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Mary will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of maize, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Mary plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of maize

loans.name: Aba

texts.en:
Even though Aba grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Aba is an entrepreneur. She sells rice in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began six years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. 

Aba has identified that there is growing demand among consumers for her product. Nevertheless, she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory capacity. Thus, she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Aba wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.es:
Susana, es soltera y tiene un hijo el cual ya es independiente, vive ella sola en casa propia ocupando solo una habitación con paredes de ladrillo, la casa se encuentra ubicada en la zona Agua de la vida de la ciudad de La Paz.
Actualmente percibe ingresos mensuales de las habitaciones que alquila en su casa, ya que debe cubrir sus gastos de alimentación y pago de servicios básicos.
El crédito lo requiere para el pago de un control de salud ya que no cuenta con seguro médico.
El sueño de Susana, es construir más habitaciones para percibir más ingresos y de esta forma mejorar su calidad de vida.
Es la segunda vez que trabaja junto a IMPRO y la primera vez con KIVA.
texts.en:
Susana is single and has a son who is independent.  She lives alone in a home she owns, occupying only a single room with brick walls.  The house is located in the Agua de la Vida section of La Paz.  She receives monthly income form the rooms she rents out in her house, which she uses to pay for food expenses and basic services.  

She is requesting a loan to pay for a doctor's appointment, because she does not have health insurance.  Susana's dream is to build more rooms in her house to increase her income and improve her quality of life.  This is the second time that she has worked with IMPRO and the first time with Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a doctor's appointment that she needs, as she does not have health insurance.

loans.name: Chemelei

texts.en:
Chemeli is 24 years old and from Serem Location in Vihiga County. She is married to Rodgers, who is also a businessman from within the location. She has two children, one being 5 years old, and the youngest one is 6 months old.

She has had a tailoring stall for the last four years and makes a monthly income of 8,510 KES (Kenyan shillings). She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD., which she will use to purchase clothing materials and purchase a new and modern sewing machine to improve her business. 

She will use the anticipated profit to start an embroidery business, as this is where she can work best due to her experience and skills. Her dream is to run a successful business and help her husband educate all their children.

loans.use: To purchase clothing materials and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Chori

texts.ru: Чори житель района Вахш, расположенный в южной части страны. Ему 55 лет. У него жена, трое сыновей и одна дочь. Чори занимается животноводческой деятельностью в течение 12 лет. Он научился этому делу у своего отца. Чори закупает крупнорогатый скот, откармливает его в течение одного месяца и затем продает с наценкой на скотном рынке. В его бизнесе помогают ему брат и сын. Одновременно Чори со своей семьей занимается и растениеводством. Кредит берет для купли и продажи крупнорогатого скота с целью увеличения поголовья продаваемого скота.
texts.en:
Chori is a resident of the Vakhsh region, located in the southern part of the country. He is 55 years old. He is married and has three sons and one daughter. 

Chori has worked with cattle breeding activities for a period of 12 years. He learnt this activity from this father. Chori purchases cattle, fattens them for a period of one month and then sells them at a higher price at the cattle market. His brother and his son helps him with this business. At the same time, Chori and his family also work with crop production. 

He takes a loan to purchase cattle for reselling, with an aim to increase the number of cattle for sale.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for reselling

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Ama is an entrepreneur. 

She specializes in selling cosmetics in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 4 years. Ama is married and has 3 children. Her husband is currently unemployed. As the sole breadwinner in the family, the proceeds from her business normally go towards covering the entire family’s general expenses. Ama wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cosmetics. 

In the long term, Ama plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of cosmetics

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman aged thirty four years. She operates a boutique where she sells clothes like skirts, shirts and trousers. Her customers are the local residents. 

She has been in this business for seven years and hopes that she will grow her business and open other branches in future. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She is a persistent woman. Her current challenge is lack of sufficient funds to run the business.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for sale

loans.name: Ala`a

texts.en:
Ala`a is a 31-year-old married man and father of three children. He has been working in the transportation business for three years to make sure his family has a good standard of living. He started his own business and bought a bus for providing family transport. 

Sometimes he doesn't work because he doesn't have enough money to repair his bus. So, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER (Yemen rials) from AMB to buy spare parts to use for his transportation service. He hopes to increase his profit to accumulate money to buy another bus.

loans.use: to buy spare parts.

loans.name: Ndanu

texts.en:
Ndanu is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a single mother of three school-going children and runs a charcoal-selling shop that has been in operation for the last four years. She has also invested in the transport business.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 2,650 Kenya shillings to purchase an energy-saving cooking stove. She believes this will improve their living conditions since it does not emit much smoke.

loans.use: To purchase an energy-saving cooking stove.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is a 30-year-old man. He has three children. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he grows potatoes. His primary customers are the general public. He describes his biggest business challenge to be changes in weather conditions. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to purchase sheep. His business goal is to build rental houses within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase more land.

loans.use: to purchase sheep.

loans.name: Maricella

texts.en: Maricella (on the left in the photograph) is a 51 year-old married woman with 6 children--the eldest is 27 and youngest is 8. She describes herself as trustworthy and would like to apply for a loan of KES 20,000. The loan will be used to purchase beans and maize as stock for her business. She has been in this business for 3 years. This is her second successive loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase beans and maize as stock for her business.

loans.name: Khadija

texts.en:
Khadija is a resident of Mombasa, Kenya. She is a married business lady and runs a food cafe which has been in operation for five years. Khadija employs one other person in the business.

She was introduced to Milango by her friends and is asking for a loan of 41,850 Kenya shillings to buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.
Despite the effect of low season, Khadija believes she can save the extra income for her future needs.

loans.use: To buy sugar, baking flour, frying oil, cereals, etc.

loans.name: Vaati

texts.en: Vaati is a married woman with five children. She describes herself as an honest woman who wants to improve the living standards of her children. She is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings that will be used to purchase bananas, oranges and pineapples as stock. She describes the market area as urban, and her customers are from a nearby eastate. Profits made will be used to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bananas, oranges and pineapples as stock.

loans.name: Sharon's Group

texts.en:
"Sharon's group is comprised of 3 hard working women. Sharon is 16 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. For the past 2 years, Sharon has been working hard to manage her small restaurant, where sells fast food. 

To help expand her business, Sharon has requested a loan of 300000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more Irish potatoes and cooking oil for the business, and will help Sharon to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her sister. Sharon hopes that in the future she will be able to renovate her house. 

Sharon is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities, and a forum for life-skills training.


"

loans.use: to buy more irish potatoes and cooking oil for the business,

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is a 36-year-old married woman. She has eight children with ages ranging from 4 years to 17 years. She operates a honey-selling stall where she sells honey. Her business is located in a suburban area, and her primary customers are mobile customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. 

She will use the 20,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more honey to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will succeed in life. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of honey to sell.

loans.name: Orbelina

texts.es: Orbelina, tiene 37 años de edad, es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos, vive en una aldea del municipio de Siguatepeque junto a dos de sus hijos. Ella siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, pero ya tiene su propia finca desde hace 5 años y produce café. Este producto lo vende en el mercado local del municipio. Esta solicitando un segundo préstamo a ODEF para comprar fertilizantes y poderle dar un buen mantenimiento a su finca para sacar mejor producción. Su sueño es que sus hijos se gradúen en la universidad.
texts.en: Orbelina is 37 years old.  She is a single mother with 3 children.  She lives in a village of the Siguatepeque municipality along with two of her children.  She has always worked in agriculture, but for the past 5 years she has had her own coffee field and she grows coffee.  She sells her product in the local municipal market.  She is requesting her second loan from ODEF to purchase fertilizers in order to do maintenance on her crops and increase production. Her dream is for her children to graduate from college.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for maintenance of her coffee crop.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 35 years old man from Kakamega county he supports four people in his family, he is married to Mrs. Susan who is a business lady within the same local market, he has three children aged five, nine and 12 years old respectively.

He has a retail shop where he sells motorcycle spare parts which he has been doing for the last nine years and makes a monthly income of KES. 30,000.  He is requesting his fourth loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more new spare parts for resale. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

His dream is to provide for his family and to become a successful large scale businessman.

loans.use: To Purchase motor cycle spare parts in bulk for resale

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Cecilia did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Cecilia prepares and sells banku for a living (a traditional Ghanaian dish made using fermented corn/cassava dough that is mixed proportionally and cooked in hot water into a smooth, whitish, consistent paste). She normally sells her banku in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 10 years. She is married and has four children. Due to the fact that her husband is retired, Cecilia uses all her income to feed and provide for her entire family. She will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall banku sales. Cecilia wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize and cassava.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Efua is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling clothing and footwear in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast, Ghana) and has been involved in this enterprise for one year. Efua is married with two children and her husband works as a mechanic. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Efua will use the loan to purchase more clothing and footwear, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, she plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase more clothing and footwear to sell

loans.name: Mlewa

texts.en:
Mlewa is a 26-year-old motorcycle taxi driver in Mariakani, Kenya. He is married with two children and his wife provides the family with additional income from her retail shop.

This marks Mlewa's second loan from KADET LTD to finance his business. He will use the loan to repair his motorcycle and buy stocks of sugar, cooking fat and rice for his wife's shop. 

Mlewa will use the anticipated profit to repay his loan and expand his wife's business. He hopes to have a successful business and happy life in the future.

loans.use: to repair his motorcycle and stock sugar, cooking fat and rice in his wife's shop.

loans.name: Tsovik

texts.en:
Tsovik is from Nshavan village of the Ararat region, where she lives with her husband and two children.

Jointly with her husband, Tsovik has been involved in land cultivation for 10 years already. She cultivates tomatoes as well as growing peach, apricot, plum, nut, apple and pear trees. She works hard to gather a good harvest, and her husband sells it locally. The sales of agricultural products are very important for this family because this is the main source of their income. 

Having no financial means for covering cultivation costs, Tsovik has applied to SEF International for this loan. With the help of the loan, she will be able to purchase fertilizer and seeds for cultivation of the land. The loan is important for Tsovik to continue her business and to gather income, which is vital for sustaining the family.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and seeds for cultivation of the land.

loans.name: Uzma

texts.en:
Ms Uzma is a 30-year-old married woman who has been running a beauty-parlor business for the last 4 years. She has four children who all attend school.  In order to meet the needs of her children, she is working hard to contribute to the family income. 

She has become famous on her street for providing the best quality services of makeup and hair styling. In order to meet the increasing demands of her customers, she is interested in buying more cosmetics products for the parlor.  But because she has little cash on hand, she contacted Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. She needs a loan of Rs 30,000 to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She hopes to cater to more customers time after time.  She dreams of expanding her business in the near future. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy hair care products, skin products and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 48, is from the Usenge region in Siaya county. He is married to Nancy who helps in running the business. They have three children who are 15, 13 and 10 years old.

He has a cosmetics shop within Usenge Town. He has been doing this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of KES 30,000. He has applied for the third loan with KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more products of cosmetics for resale. He will use the anticipated profit to grow his business.

He has a dream of of growing her business into a large one and taking care of his family.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a 35 year old married man who describes himself as an honest father. He has applied for a loan of 20,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) through SMEP DTM that he will use to purchase tea and snacks for his catering business. This is his first application for a loan. He describes his neighborhood as reliable and says that his customers are his neighbors.

loans.use: To purchase tea and snacks for his catering business.

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education. However, this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. She has been selling charcoal in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast, Ghana) for about three years. She is married to a photographer and together they have four children. 

Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the loan to purchase more charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. She wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal, which will help her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Haron

texts.en:
Haron owns a retail shop. He is now the proud father of one child. After being initially funded by KADET LTD he was able to start a grocery store with the profits he obtained from his shop. 

He is requesting another business loan to buy more cabbage, kale, tomatoes and spinach. He hopes to provide his child with the best education.

loans.use: to buy more cabbage, kale, tomatoes and spinach

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama is a widow and has 6 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama is a successful businesswoman. She sells groceries in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast) in Ghana. She has been actively involved in this business for about 5 years. As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase groceries to sell, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Rita

texts.en: Rita is a 32 year old mother of two. She is applying for a loan of kes 25,000 that she will use to purchase charcoal for additional retail stock. She has been in this business for 2 years. This is her 1st loan through SMEP DTM.

loans.use: To purchase charcoal for additional retail stock.

loans.name: Avaz

texts.ru: Авазу 39 лет. Он женат и отец одного ребенка, который учится в школе. Жена его не работает, она ведет домашнее хозяйство. Аваз в семье единственный кормилец. У него среднее техническое образование, он по специальности инженер, но по профессии не работал. Он зарабатывает на жизнь занимаясь растениеводством. Аваз в этой области уже 10 лет. Он арендует земельный участок, на котором выращивает зерновые культуры, а именно рис и кукурузу. Аваз нуждается в кредите, чтобы провести обработку земли. Он просит кредит для закупа топлива и минеральных удобрений для урожая риса и кукурузы. За счет прибыли с продажи урожая Аваз хочет приобрести необходимую бытовую технику.
texts.en:
Avaz is 39 years old. He is married and the father of one child, who goes to school. His wife does not work, she leads the household. 

Avaz is the sole supporter of the family. He has secondary technical education, he is an engineer, but he does not work with his profession. He earns money for living through crop production. Avaz has been in this area for 10 years already. He rents a plot of land, on which he grows crops, namely rice and corn. 

Avaz needs a loan in order to process the land. He requests a loan for the purchase of fuel and mineral fertilizers for the harvest of rice and corn. With the profit from selling the harvest, Avaz would like to purchase necessary home appliances.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and mineral fertilizers for the harvest of rice and corn

loans.name: Mahmadamin

texts.ru: Махмадамин холостой молодой человек. Ему 21 год. Он живет с родителями в районе Дж.Руми. Махмадамин занимается животноводством и сельским хозяйством. Он очень энергичный и предприимчивый человек. Сейчас Махмадамин хочет заняться новым видом бизнеса. Он намерен открыть хлопкоочистительный цех. Для этого у него имеется помещение для ведения деятельности, необходимые рабочие инструменты, а также имеется опыт в этой сфере. Чтобы реализовать свою цель Махмадамин обратился за кредитом. Он просит кредит для закупа хлопкоочистительного оборудования и очень надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Mahmadamin is a single young man. He is 21 years old. He lives with his parents in the J. Rumy region. Mahmadamin works with livestock breeding and agriculture. He is a very energetic and enterprising man. 

Currently Mahmadamin would like to start a new type of business. He intends to open a cotton ginning plant. For this he needs premises to conduct the business, necessary tools, and further to get experience in this field. 

In order to realize his goal, Mahmadamin applied for a loan. He requests a loan for the purchase of ginning equipment and very much hopes for your support.

loans.use: to purchase ginning equipment

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Adwowa is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling saucepans in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast) in Ghana. She has been involved in this enterprise for 1 year. Adwowa is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a farmer. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. Adwowa wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to sell greater quantities of saucepans. In the long term, Adwowa plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels allowing her to sell greater quantities of saucepans

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is aged 35 and married to Christine with eight children. 6 of them go to school. He also has 1 dependent who stays with him due to old age.

Edward is a fish monger, he works 6 days a week and 13 hrs a day. The business started in 1992 in the Kagadi main market in Uganda to support his family. His clients are primarily from Kagadi town. He also earns some additional income from selling cassava.

Edward has requested a loan of 500,000 to increase his stock. His main challenge is competition and fake currency. He is hard working and would like the loan to make more products available for sale.

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Efua sells maize in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been in this business for about 6 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 3 children. Efua uses all of her income to feed and provide for her family. She will use the requested loan to purchase an increased amount of maize, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all of her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of maize

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a 65-year-old married woman. She has 7 children whose ages range from 21 years to 42 years. She describes herself as honest. Esther operates a cereals store where she sells maize and beans. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient capital. Esther will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy maize and beans to sell. Her business goal is to be self-sustaining within 5 years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be self-reliant. This is her third loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy maize and beans to sell

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Due to difficult circumstances, Comfort did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. Currently, Comfort prepares and sells gari (a traditional Ghanaian snack that is made from starched powdered cassava) in her village of Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 13 years. She is married to a mechanical engineer, and together they have 5 children. Comfort uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Comfort will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall gari sales. Comfort wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of cassava, which will aid her in improving her overall gari sales

loans.name: Adwowa

texts.en: Adwowa is divorced and has 4 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, she is a successful businesswoman. She sells palm kernel oil in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 8 years. As the sole breadwinner, Adwowa uses her income to provide for the entire family. She will use the requested loan to purchase increased amounts of palm fruit, thus aiding her in improving her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Adwowa plans to further diversify the types of products that she sells, thereby adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of palm fruit

loans.name: Monica

texts.en: Although she has received no prior formal education, Monica is an entrepreneur. She is a hairdresser in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Monica is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a mason. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and to pay their children’s school fees. Monica wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, thereby allowing her to increase her customer base. In the long term, Monica plans to reinvest her future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, allowing her to increase her customer base

loans.name: Mavis

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Mavis is an entrepreneur. 

She specializes in selling rice, beans, and groundnuts in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 3 years. Mavis is married and has 7 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go towards helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and pay their children’s school fees. 

Mavis wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of rice, beans, and groundnuts. In the long term, Mavis plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her expand and meet the needs of rising customer demands.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Even though Agnes grew up in poverty without an education, this has not stopped her from fulfilling her dream of achieving a better life for her and her family. Currently, Agnes is an entrepreneur. She sells cooked rice in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). Her business enterprise has grown substantially since she began 5 years ago. She uses the income from her business to help her husband raise their child. 

Agnes has identified that there are growing demands among consumers’ for her product. Nevertheless she is unable to meet their needs due to limited inventory. Thus she aims to use her loan to purchase more rice to sell. With the new profits from her expanded business, Agnes wants to buck the trend by ensuring that all her children will be given the opportunity to further distance their family from poverty.

loans.use: to purchase more rice to sell

loans.name: Efua

texts.en:
Due to difficult circumstances Efua did not have access to any form of formal education, yet this has not stopped her from achieving her dream of becoming an entrepreneur. 

Currently, Efua sells charcoal  in  Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been doing so for about 4 years. She is married to a farmer, and together they have 5 children. Efua uses all her income to feed and provide for her family. Efua will use the loan to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales. 

Efua wants to use the future profits from her expanded business to ensure that all her children are able to receive an education.

loans.use: to purchase an increased amount of charcoal, which will aid her in improving her overall sales

loans.name: Elizabeth Jacqueline

texts.es:
La clienta Elizabeth vive en Guayaquil.  Empezó su negocio de venta de ropa y de zapatos en el año de 1995 en Manabí, realizando el trabajo con sus hijos. Actualmente sigue en el comercio de ropa y zapatos. 

La dificultad que ella tiene es el invierno ya que no puede trabajar bien porque ella reparte su ropa a diferentes lugares. Es casada su esposo es maestro en una empresa tiene 4 hijos los cuales 2 de ellos son menores y estudian en escuela fiscal.

Con el préstamo quiere comprar zapatos y ropa. Su sueño es tener un local comercial para la venta de su mercadería.
texts.en:
Elizabeth lives in Guayaquil.  She started her business by working with her children and selling clothes and shoes in 1995 in Manabí.  She now continues in the business of selling clothes and shoes.

The difficulty that she has is that in the winter she is not able to work well.  This is because she delivers clothes to different places.  

She is married, and her husband is a skilled workman for a company.  She has four children.  Two of them are minors, and they attend public school.

She wants to use the loan to buy shoes and clothes.  Her dream is to have a commercial place where she can sell her merchandise.

loans.use: to buy shoes and clothes.

loans.name: Vasily

texts.ru:
Василий женат. У него четверо взрослых детей, которые живут отдельно. Однако в связи с определенными трудностями, Василий вместе с женой воспитывает внучку, которая постоянно живет с ними.

Василий работает лесничим. Василий трудолюбивый и заботится о своей семье. Он хочет улучшить жилищные условия и сделать паровое отопление. Василий просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 5000 гривен на покупку отопительного котла.
texts.en:
Vasily is married. He has four adult children, who live separately. However, due to certain difficulties, Vasily and his wife raise a granddaughter, who lives permanently with them. 

Vasily works as a forester. He is hard working and cares for his family. He would like to improve their living conditions and make a steam heating system. Vasily requests a loan in the amount of 5,000 hryvnia for the purchase of a boiler.

loans.use: to purchase a boiler to heat his house

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Although she has received no prior formal education, Gloria is an entrepreneur. She specializes in selling cloth in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been involved in this enterprise for 7 years. Gloria  is married and has 2 children. Her husband works as a taxi driver. The proceeds from her business normally go toward helping her husband cover the family’s general expenses and paying their children’s school fees.

Gloria wants to use her loan to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cloth. In the long term, Gloria plans to reinvest future profits into her business, thus helping her to expand and meet rising customer demand.

loans.use: to increase her current inventory levels, hence allowing her to sell greater quantities of cloth.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 57 years old, married and a father of six children. For the last twenty years, he has earned a living by selling farm produce in Mpeketoni, Lamu. He earns a monthly profit of KES. 10,000. 

Daniel was introduced to KADET LTD by a credit officer, and is applying for his third loan of KES. 20,000, to buy farm inputs such as seeds, fertilizer and insecticides for his farming business during this rainy season. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay school fees for his children and to expand his farming activities. His goal for the future is to venture into mixed farming to increase his income, enhance his financial stability and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs such as fertilizer and insecticides

loans.name: Ama

texts.en:
Ama is a widow and has 7 children. Even though she did not receive any formal education, Ama  is a successful businesswoman. She sells used clothing in Asebu Ekrokul (near Cape Coast). She has been actively involved in this business for about 2 years. 

As the sole breadwinner in the family, Ama uses her income to provide for the entire family. Ama will use the loan to purchase increased amounts of used clothing, thus aiding her to improve her overall sales. With the new profits from her expanded business, Ama plans to further diversify the type of products that she sells, hence adapting to changing customer preferences.

loans.use: to purchase increased amounts of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth is a married woman with 10 children. She is applying for a loan of KES 10,000 through SMEP DTM that will be used to purchase another cow to boost her milk sales. In future she sees herself with lots of cows to boost her milk production.

loans.use: To purchase another cow to boost her milk sales.

loans.name: Matida

texts.en: Matilda is a 42-year-old woman with 3 children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her main business is farming, which she started way back in 1989 with the aim of raising school fees for her children. Her major hardships are unpredictable weather changes and inflation while her dreams are to educate her children to higher levels of education and to venture into dairy farming. Matilda is requesting a loan to buy two exotic cows to sell.

loans.use: to buy exotic cows for rearing.

loans.name: Happy Ayllu Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “HAPPY AYLLU”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.                                                                                                                                                                                             

La socia es la Sra. Bertha ella es casada y tiene 62 años y tiene 2 hijos; La socia trabaja como profesora, la socia enseña a niños de primaria, la socia trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 1:00 p.m,la socia se dedica a este trabajo y le va muy bien, el sueño de la socia es tener una tienda donde vende la ropa. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar libros, cuadernos y lapiceros para trabajar como profesora.
La socia que esta pegada a al foto grupal se le tomo la foto despues de la reunion porque pidio permiso por motivos de trabajo.
La socia que esta tapada su cara con un circulo se retiro del banco comunal Happy Ayllu
 Los otros socios se dedican al negocio de venta de venta de productos de belleza, negocio de venta de ropa, negocio de tienda de abarrotes y negocio de venta de gaseosas.

 
La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members belong to Happy Ayllu Communal Bank, located in the district of Cusco in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The member is Bertha, 62.  She's married and has two children.  She works as an elementary-school teacher from 8 a.m. until 1 p.m.  She's dedicated to this job and it's going very well for her.  Her dream is to have a store where she sells clothing.

She's requesting the loan to buy books, notebooks, and pens to work as a teacher.

The member attached to the group photo had permission to have her photograph taken after the meeting because of work.  The member whose face is covered with a circle has left Happy Ayllu Communal Bank.

The businesses of the other members are selling beauty products, clothing, groceries, and soda.

She's grateful to those who are part of her dream through this loan and she promises to make her payments punctually.

loans.use: to buy books, notebooks, and pens

loans.name: Teresa Reina

texts.es: doña teresa de 41 años de edad vive con su esposo en casa propia; ella posee una tienda donde vende artículos de primera necesidad, frijoles, leche, huevos, pan, azucar, cafe, shampoos, jabones entre otros, tiene muchos años con su negocio y eso le ha regalado experiencia en las ventas que le permite obtener las mejores ganancias, esta ubicado en el lugar de su residencia, es muy reconocido por los vecinos de la zona , se ha hecho de mucha clientela, pues tiene la tienda surtida, ella quiere acrecentar el negocio y realizar una nueva inversión pero necesita de capital por eso solicita un crédito que le permita comprar lo necesario para su tienda, asegura que cancelara la deuda y a la vez confía en que tendra una mejor calidad de vida
texts.en:
Teresa, 41, lives with her husband in her own home. She owns a store where she sells basic goods, beans, milk, eggs, bread, sugar, coffee, shampoo, soap and so on. She has spent many years in her business and this has given her sales experience which allows her to obtain better profits. The store is located in her home and is well known by the locals in the area. Teresa has grown a large customer base which is why she stores the store well. 

Teresa wants to expand the business and make a new investment but needs capital, hence why she is seeking a loan to allow her to buy what is needed in the store. Teresa pledges to repay the loan and is confident of having a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as rice, beans, oil, macaroni, coffee and so on.

loans.name: Nikolai

texts.ru:
Николай занимается тепличным хозяйством.  Благодаря предыдущему кредиту смог увеличить прибыль и купил новую машину. Николай смог больше помогать своим детям. Также он начал дополнительно заниматься изготовлением и продажей котлов.

Николай имеет большие планы на будущее. Хочет усовершенствовать отопление в своих теплицах -   вместо трех маленьких котлов на каждой теплице  поставить один большой на все теплицы сразу.

Николай просит предоставить ему кредит в сумме 20000 гривен на покупку угля и пленки для теплиц, а также электростанции, которая будет обеспечивать его дом и теплицы электроенергией постоянно (т.к. электроэнергию в селе часто отключают).
texts.en:
Nikolai works with greenhouse farming. Thanks to the previous loan he was able to increase his income and purchase a new car. In addition, Nikolai was able to help his children. Further he started an additional business of manufacturing and selling boilers. 

Nikolai have larger plans for the future. He would like to improve the heating in his greenhouses - instead of three small boilers in each greenhouse, he wants to place one large boiler in all greenhouses at once. Nikolai requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia for the purchase of charcoal and plastic film for the greenhouses, and further electric power that would provide his home and greenhouses with constant electrical energy (as the electricity in the is village often out).

loans.use: to purchase charcoal and plastic film for his greenhouses, and further electric power

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la clienta vive en casa de un familiar con su hija, ella tiene un negocio de ropa y golosinas como refrescos, galletas, etc desde hace varios años, esta ubicada contiguo a la carretera cerca de su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela pues es un lugar muy estrategico. La clienta quiere acrecentar su negocio pero no tiene capital para poder realizarlo por eso solicita un credito que le permita comprar mas mercaderia como: churros, galletas, blusas, faldas y todo lo necesario para tener mas clientela y tener mejores ingresos para darle una mejor vida a su hija.
texts.en:
The client lives in a relative's house with her daughter.

For several years she has had a business selling clothing and snacks such as soft drinks, cookies, etc.  It's located next to the highway near where she lives.  She has a lot of customers because it's a strategic location.

She wants to expand her business but she doesn't have the capital.  She's requesting a loan to buy more merchandise such as chips, cookies, blouses, skirts, and everything she needs to have more customers and a better income to give her daughter a better life.

loans.use: to buy snacks, soft drinks, clothing, etc.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana tiene 53 años de edad y esta casada con Narciso de 48 años con quien tiene una casa hecha de adobe y vive junto a sus 5 hijos.Tiene un terreno agrícola de 5 hectáreas en donde cultiva cacao orgánico, café y achiote.
Al comprometerse con Narciso recibió un terreno agrícola por parte de sus padres como herencia para trabajarla y obtener dinero.Años después logró adquirir más terrenos en donde el cacao orgánico logra obtener una buena calidad gracias al suelo que posee.Su principal inconveniente al iniciar su labor fue de no contar con dinero suficiente para contratar trabajadores del lugar y abono orgánico obligandola a triplicar sus horas de trabajo.Se dirige todas las mañanas a sus parcelas para desempeñar sus labores con el deseo de obtener cacao de calidad y recuperar el capital invertido vendiendo los granos a los compradores de la zona.Cuenta siempre con el apoyo de sus hijos para labores menores y ahora contrata a trabajadores para el retiro de mala hierba y la cosecha . Su principal objetivo es construir su vivienda con material noble porque su actual vivienda ya presenta algunos deterioros por el paso de los años.Es la segunda vez que Kiva le otorga un préstamo motivo por el cual se siente agradecida y considera el dinero otorgado como una buena herramienta de trabajo.Requiere en esta ocasión 3,500 nuevos soles para comprar abono orgánico.
texts.en:
Juana, 53, is married to Narciso who is 48 and with whom she has a home made of adobe and lives together with their five children. She owns a five hectare plot of land in which she grows organic cacao, coffee and annatto.

In getting married to Narciso, Juana received a plot of agricultural land from her parents as inheritance to till and earn money. Years on, she was successful in acquiring more land, where there is organic cacao. Thanks to the quality of the soil, she is able to obtain a good quality of product.

The main inconvenience Juana faced when she started this work was that of not having enough money to hire local laborers nor organic fertilizer which forced her to triple her working hours. Every morning, she heads to her plots of land to work them all with the aim of obtaining high-quality cacao and recuperating the capital invested by selling the grains to buyers in the area.

Juana can always rely on her children's help for small jobs and today she hires workers to do the weeding and harvesting. Her main objective is to build her home with good materials as her current home is already presenting signs of damage over the course of time. 

This is the second time that Kiva has given Juana a loan which is why she is grateful and believes that the money given is a good work tool. On this occasion, Juana needs a loan of 3,500 Peruvian Nuevos Soles to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Nidia Vilma

texts.es:
Nidia es una mujer de 23 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Pucallpa con sus padres y hermanos, Nidia es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Nidia no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Arte, en sus ratos libres le gusta cocinar una riquísima Pachamanca de Cerdo par compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Nidia trabaja en su pequeña tienda de venta de abarrotes, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 12 horas y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amble que brinda a sus clientes.
Nidia se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, menestras, bebidas y otros, de esta manera Nidia tendrá su tienda mejor abastecida y podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Nidia is a 23-year-old woman. She is single and lives in the city of Pucallpa with her parents and brothers. Nidia is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person who has a strong desire to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources and the need to work since she was very young, Nidia was not able to study for a professional art career.  In her free time she likes to cook a very delicious Pachamanca de Cerdo (Pachamanca of Pork) to share with her family. 

From her own initiative and with a lot of determination and dedication, Nidia works in her small grocery store. She works every day for approximately 12 hours per day. She thinks that she does well because of her good prices and for her kind treatment of her clients.

Nidia is very grateful for Kiva lenders. Thanks to their help provided she will be able to purchase a greater quantity and variety of groceries such as rice, sugar, stew, drinks, and others. This way Nidia will have her store better supplied and be able to obtain more clients. She will continue working and expending effort to achieve her big dream of growing her business.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of items

loans.name: Lubov

texts.ru:
Любовь занимается выращиванием овощей в теплице (также у нее есть небольшой магазин по продаже одежды). Благодаря предыдущему кредиту она смогла получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить качество жизни - провести интернет, съездить на отдых.

В прошлом году вернулся сын Любови из столицы, где он раньше жил и работал. Теперь он будет помогать матери с теплицами, так как ей уже тяжело справляться одной.

В этом сезоне Любовь садит помидоры. Кредит нужен на закупку рассады (10 тыс. гривен), пленки (7 тыс.) и удобрений (3 тыс.). Любовь надеется получить хороший урожай.
texts.en:
Lubov works with growing vegetable in greenhouses (she also has a small store for selling clothes). Thanks to the previous loan she was able to get an additional income and improve her life quality - install internet and go on holiday. 

Last year Lubov's son returned from the capital, where he previously lived and worked. Currently he will help his mother with the greenhouses, as it is already hard for her to manage alone. 

This season Lubov is planting tomatoes. She needs a loan for the purchase of seedlings (10,000 hryvnia), plastic film (7,000 hryvnia) and fertilizers (3,000 hryvnia). Lubov hopes to get a large harvest.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings, plastic film and fertilizers for her greenhouses

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: el señor Jose Alfredo es soltero, padre de tres hijos que ninguno depende de el, el trabaja para el sostén de su vivienda, trabaja de lunes a domingo desde las siete de la mañana hasta las cuatro de la tarde, el señor vende abarroterias, frambuesas, vainillas, vinagres, miel, en uno de los mercados de chinandega  desde hace 10 años, anteriormente trabajaba para una empresa, y con ahorro decidió comprar mas mercadería para surtir el negocio de su esposa y al fallecer ella, él decidió seguir con el negocio.
texts.en: Jose Alfredo is single and father to three children, none of whom are dependent on him. Jose Alfredo works to support his household, working from Monday to Sunday from 7:00am to 4:00pm. He has been selling groceries such as raspberries, vanilla, vinager and honey in one of the markets of the town of Chinandega for 10 years. Prior to that, he worked for a business, and with his savings, he decided to buy more merchandise to stock his wife's business. It was when she died that Jose Alfredo decided to continue the business.

loans.use: to buy crates of raspberries, vanilla and vinager.

loans.name: Elmurod

texts.ru: Элмурод молодой энергичный мужчина, имеет большую семью, он отец четырех детей. Он в школе учился хорошо и поступил в университет на педагогический факультет. После окончания университета устроился на работу в сельской школе. Он старательно преподавал и очень хотел, чтобы дети односельчан были грамотными и образованными. Но из-за того, что зарплата учителей маленькая и не хватает на жизнь он был вынужден оставить работу. Он сейчас занимается и животноводством и дехканским хозяйством. Выращивает арбуз, дыню и другие овощи, продает в основном на местном рынке и запасает себе на зиму. В своем участке также откармливает скот, поэтому на полученную сумму хочет купить еще две головы скота.
texts.en:
Elmurod is a young and energetic man, who has a large family: He is the father of four children. He studied well at school and entered the pedagogical faculty of the university. After finishing university he took a job at a village school. He taught studiously and very much wanted the village children to be literate and well-educated. But because the teaching salary was small, and not enough for living, he was forced to leave the job. 

Currently he works with livestock breeding and dekhan farming. He grows watermelon, cantaloupe and other vegetables, and sells them mainly at the local market and stores them for himself for the winter. On his plot he also fattens cattle, and therefore he would like to purchase two more heads of livestock for the loan received.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard is a 53-year-old man with 3 children. He describes himself as determined. Bernard operates a grocery store where he sells bananas, tomatoes, onions, and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in an area with lots of customers, and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge as a lack of capital. He will use the requested KES 50,000 loan to buy stocks of bananas, tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables. His business goal is to own a big grocery within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bananas, tomatoes, onions, and other vegetables

loans.name: Anna

texts.ru:
Анна тогрует на рынке женской обувью уже 10 лет. За это время она приобрела много постоянных покупателей. Ей нравится этот бизнес. Она обслуживает каждого клиента индивидуально, помогая подобрать подходящую обувь по доступной цене.

Анна хочет закупить летнюю обувь. Расширенный ассортимент поможет ей более качественно обслуживать своих покупателей, предоставляя им широкий выбор. Анна просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен. Она надеется получить дополнительную прибыль и улучшить свои жилищные условия. Она живет с мужем и двумя детьми - дочкой (13 лет) и сыном (5 лет).
texts.en:
Anna has been selling women's shoes as the market for 10 years already. In this time she has gotten many loyal customers. She likes this business. She listens to each individual customer, and helps them find the right shoes at an affordable price. 

Anna would like to purchase summer shoes. A broader assortment helps her to better serve her customers, providing them with a larger choice. Anna requests a loan in the amount of 20,000 hryvnia. She hopes to get an additional income and improve her living conditions. She lives together with her husband and two children - a 13 year old daughter and a 5 year old son.

loans.use: to expand her assortment of summer shoes

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en: Consolata is a hardworking 48-year-old woman with 5 children who lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. Selling used clothes is her main business, which she started with an aim of having a source of income to help look after her family. Ever-changing customer preferences coupled with inadequate capital affect her business growth while she dreams of owning a modern boutique. Consolata intends to use the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en: Stephen is a 52-year-old married man with 3 children. He describes himself as ambitious. He operates a construction materials business where he sells building stones. He has been involved in this business for 20 years. His business is located in an area with potential, and his primary customers are local residents and construction firms. Stephen describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. He will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy more building stones to sell. He hopes that, in the future, he will excel in his business. He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy more building stones to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a 30-year-old married woman. She has 7 children with ages ranging from 2 years to 14 years. She describes herself as aggressive and committed. She operates a retail shop where she sells toothpaste, drinks, sugar, and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in an area with lots of customers, and her primary customers are local residents. Emily describes her biggest business challenges as transport and government policies. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy stocks of toothpaste, drinks, sugar, and other items. Her business goal is to be stable and successful within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of toothpaste, drinks, sugar and other items

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en: Agnes is a 35-year-old married woman. She has 3 children whose ages range from 9 years to 17 years. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a grocery store where she sells bananas, kales, fruits, and other vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with plenty of customers, and her primary customers are local residents. Agnes describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate finances. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy more stocks of bananas, kales, fruits, and other vegetables. Her business goal is to be self-reliant within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of bananas, kales, fruits, and other vegetables

loans.name: Sarata

texts.fr:
Madame  Sarata est âgée de 29 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle vit chez son mari  avec ses enfants au quartier Hamdallaye A    de Ségou (quatrième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant pas fréquenté  l’école pour des raisons sociales, elle commença très tôt à faire les activités génératrices de revenus auprès de sa mère qui vendait des condiments. Après plusieurs années d’apprentissage à son coté, elle finit seule à  mener plusieurs activités (vente de savons, de céréales etc.)  bien avant d’embrasser le commerce de noix de coco.  Elle fait cette activité depuis 10 ans et bénéficie d’un bon réseau de clientèle. Sa force de vente est due à sa maitrise du rouage de l’activité mais également à son prix abordable par rapport à beaucoup de ses conquérants.   
 Dans le but  d’augmenter son fonds de commerce pour faire face à la demande clientèle, elle a  fait recours à Soro Yiriwaso, elle est en relation avec cette dernière depuis 72 mois, après avoir fait 4 prêts solidaires et 4 prêts  individuel bien  remboursés, elle est à son 5ème prêt individuel qu’elle compte utiliser  pour acheter ,  2000 noix de coco,  elle s’approvisionne  sur place.   
Madame    Sarata   vend au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes, avec ce prêt  elle envisage  réaliser un bénéfice mensuel 90.000 FCFA qui lui permettra  de prendre en charge les dépenses familiales et d’augmenter son fonds de  commerce.
texts.en:
Mrs. Sarata is 29 years old, married and the mother of three. She lives with her husband and children in the Hamdallaye A district of Ségou (the fourth administrative region of Mali). Not having attended school for social reasons, from an early age on she started earning a living alongside her mother, who used to sell condiments. After several years of this apprenticeship, she tried various business activities on her own (selling soap, cereals etc) before ending up selling coconuts. She has been in this business for 10 years and has a large customer base. Her success is due to her skill in running this business and also to her affordable prices in comparison to the competition.

With the goal of increasing her working capital and meeting customer demand, she has reached out to Soro Yiriwaso. She has been collaborating with Soro Yiriwaso for 72 months; after four solidarity loans and four individual loans, all duly reimbursed, she is now on her fifth individual loan intended to buy 2,000 coconuts. She stocks up locally. Mrs. Sarata sells for cash and on credit to a customer base composed mainly of women. With this loan, she anticipates earning a monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will allow her to take her of household expenses and bolster her working capital.

loans.use: to buy coconuts.

loans.name: Nazir

texts.en:
Ms. Nazir is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been running a business selling milk with the support of her husband for 25 years. She has two buffalo in milk and sells their milk to many of their neighbors, along with butter and cheese that they make from the milk.  By this time she has become famous for providing good quality milk and earns enough income to contribute to the family income. 

She is a mother of two sons and needs to earn much more to meet their everyday expenditures, including food, clothing and education. In order to make huge profits, she requested a loan of PKR 25,000 to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales. She hopes to increase the milk-production capacity of her business, which would ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to increase her sales.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Ms. Shehnaz is a 32-year-old married woman and the mother of four. She has been running a business selling clothes for about eight years. She purchases a variety of clothes from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good quality clothes in her community.

Shehnaz requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through her greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of different clothes for the summer season

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Ms. Razia is a 55-year-old married woman who has been running a business selling milk with her husband for 30 years. Over this time, Razia has become famous in her area for providing good quality milk. She counts a good client list and makes enough to contribute to her family's income. She has four buffaloes.

Razia requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) from Kashf Foundation to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and plans to spend her profits on expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Besty

texts.en:
Besty is a 48-year-old married woman. She has seven children with ages ranging from 3 to 24 years old. She describes herself as successful. She operates a farm business selling maize and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

Besty will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to increase her farming area by buying more cereal seeds and fertilizer to plant. She hopes that her future will be stable. She will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to increase her farming area by buying more cereal seeds and fertilizer to plant

loans.name: Beldine

texts.en:
Beldine is a 29-year-old married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as determined. She operates a tailoring business where she repairs clothes for customers. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in an area with potential, and her primary customers are local residents. 

Beldine describes her biggest business challenge as lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy another sewing machine. Her business goal is to own a big place for sewing in town within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own many sewing machines. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy another sewing machine

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 29-year-old married woman. She has six children with ages ranging from two to eighteen years. She describes herself as patient and a risk-taker. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area with many customers, and her primary customers are local residents. 

She describes her biggest business challenge as lack of enough milk. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to to buy another cow. Her business goal is to be a commercial dairy farmer within five years. She will use the profits to repay the loan. She also sells beans and green grams to supplement her income.

loans.use: to buy another cow

loans.name: Christine's Group

texts.en:
Christine's group is comprised of two hardworking women. Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Luwero in the Luwero region of Uganda. She is single and has three children who are all currently in school. For the past three years, Christine has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells shoes.
