To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 150,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes to sell. This will help Christine to generate greater profits and provide basic needs for her family. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to pay school fees for her children. 

Christine is a member of BRAC's Empowerment and Livelihood for Adolescents (ELA) program. In addition to microfinance loans, the program provides both a safe place for young Ugandan women to take part in group activities and a forum for life-skills training.

loans.use: to buy more shoes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a wall and to fix the yard

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Nazlisha

texts.en:
Nazlisha is 43 years old and married. She has been making and selling dresses and skirts for her local customers for more than 25 years. Nazlisha operates a small store at her home, where she lives with her husband and three children in the southern part of Kosovo. Her husband works as a driver with a very low salary.
 
Customers visit her at her home every day. Her business is going very well, thanks to the committed effort she puts into her work. She is in need of a loan in order to buy material for her work.  

Nazlisha’s goal is to improve the living conditions of her family and to save money toward her children's education. She is very happy for this opportunity and wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy material for her work.

loans.name: Bujar

texts.en:
Bujar is 22 years old and single. He lives in the southern part with his parents. To earn a living, Bujar works in a car wash with a very low salary. The current main source of income for his family comes from Bujar.

Bujar’s family owns a house that is need of renovation and has not had any repairs or renovations in the last several years.

Bujar now is in need of a loan to renovate his kitchen and rooms. Renovation in this manner will allow his family to live a normal life. His goal is to open his own car wash and save the money for his future.

Bujar really appreciates this help!

loans.use: to renovate the kitchen and rooms.

loans.name: Mirjana

texts.en:
Mirjana, 36, is married and lives with her husband and three children in a minority community. Mirjana works in a municipality on administration and her husband works as a teacher. Currently they live in a house which is in need of renovation. 

Due to the high cost of electricity, they want to put a façade on their house in order to save costs on heating in the winter. Mirjana is requesting a loan to pay for the façade for her house and to do insulation. This loan will help improve their living conditions. She hopes that by doing this they will be able to save some of the money from their salaries to ensure financial security. 

In the near future, she is hoping to have a better life. Mirjana is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: to add a façade and insulation to her house.

loans.name: Leonicia  Gumercinda

texts.es: Leonicia de 35 años de edad, vive con esposo y su hijo de 16 años de edad en casa propia. Leonicia es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora. Hace algunos años se decidió en poner un pequeño negocio en su hogar el negocio consiste en una pequeña tienda que con gran esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado mantener a lo largo de 5 años. Cuenta con mucha clientela ya que para ella lo más importante son los clientes, siempre los atiende con una sonrisa y mucha amabilidad ella sueña con dar a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida y sabe que la única fuente de ingresos es su pequeño negocio, por eso ella solicita un crédito a INTEGRAL para poder invertir en su tiendita y abastecerla con todo tipo de productos como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, café, golosinas, aceite, papel, detergente y de  más productos atractivos para los clientes. Confía que de esta manera logrará cumplir su sueño y tendra una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en: Leonicia is 35 years old. She lives with her husband and her sixteen-year-old son in a house of her own. She is full of enterprising spirit and never admits defeat in the face of hardship. A few years ago, she decided to start a small shop at her house, and has been keeping this small business going for five years, thanks to her great dedication and to all the efforts she made. Leonicia has a lot of customers, whom she values above all else in her business, and for whom she always has a warm smile ready. Her dream is to give her son a better life. She knows her small business is her only source of income, which is why she asks field partner Integral for a loan in order to invest in it. She needs to buy supplies of all kinds to sell, such as rice, broad beans, sugar, milk, coffee, candy, cooking oil, paper, detergent, and other products that are very much in demand. She feels confident that this investment will help her make her dream come true and grant her more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sell at her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a new stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is married and has two children. He owns a transportation business, which he has been operating for four years.

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. Joseph is applying for a loan of 73,100 KES to buy a new motorcycle. His extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to increase his savings. His dream is to expand and buy a vehicle to offer taxi services.

loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle.

loans.name: Gary

texts.en:
For more than 30 years, Gary worked as a contracted aircraft builder and rebuilder, traveling from job to job across the United States. He was paid well. But then the industry started steadily declining, and work got sent overseas. Finally, he said, contract work just disappeared. 

As work started drying up five years ago, Gary slowly turned his hobby and passion for attending motorcycle events into a business. 

“Basically, it was out of desperation to find something to do to sustain myself,” Gary said. “I’ve always gone to motorcycle events, but never as a vendor. But I had seen people doing it and knew it was something I could do.”

At first, Gary sold just a few hats at a time, using a friend’s table, and discovered that the “Made in America” label drew customers to his hats. 

Gary recently officially opened a full-time business, doing business as Bud’s Emporium and also as Daddy BUD’s DooRags. He travels the Southern part of the nation, going to motorcycle events and music festivals, selling doorags – motorcycle riders’ head coverings, and welder’s style hats, face coverings, neck coolers, highway and motorcycle-related vintage-style signs, jewelry, as well as Android phones and computer tablets. He doesn’t have a website, but he has a Facebook page where people can keep track of his locations: https://www.facebook.com/DaddyBUDsDooRags 

Gary took his first spin on a motorcycle when he was five years old, when a teen-aged neighbor was offering kids rides on his Cushman Eagle. That first ride turned a fascination into a passion and a lifestyle for Gary, who is riding the same Harley Davidson Shovelhead that he bought in 1973.

Gary was in South Texas, working the motorcycle shows during the winter months this year, when it became clear that his truck needed to be replaced. He learned about Accion Texas through a news report with Bill Clinton announcing the Kiva-Accion Texas partnership in Little Rock this March.

“I’ve always been a fan of Bill Clinton and even worked on some of his campaigns,” Gary said. “When I saw this announcement, it caught my interest.”

He decided to apply for a loan to buy a used, 17-foot U-Haul box truck to replace his truck and to take his business to the next level. The larger truck enables him to create a store display area within the truck, in addition to his tented table arrangement.

Gary said that over time he has been able to build up friends and clients as a business. “Usually I am at an event and if some people know where I am, other people will find me,” Gary said. 

Gary said if the aircraft industry picked up and job recruiters called to put him back to work, he would say he was ready and available. But, he said, his focus right now is building his business and to “whittle out a niche.”

loans.use: to buy a used, 17-foot U-Haul box truck.

loans.name: Karla Patricia

texts.es:
La señora Karla Patricia es madre soltera, se dedica a su actividad de venta de mariscos en uno de los mercados de chinandega su negocio lo empezó con aporte de su hermana, empieza a laborar desde las cinco de la mañana que le traen la mercadería desde jiquilillo hasta las tres de la tarde.

la señora Karla solicita un financiamiento para la compra de mercadería lo que es pescado pargo  para mantener sus ventas  y sus ganancias, la señora se esfuerza para sacar adelante a sus hijos, tiene de trabajar con esa actividad 12 años y anteriormente se dedicaba a estudiar, ella se siente bien satisfecha  por que le han ayudado a mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karla Patricia is a single mother.  She makes a living selling fish in one of the markets in Chinandega.  She started her business with the support of her sister.  She works from 5 in the morning, when the merchandise arrives from Jiquilillo, until 3 in the afternoon.

Karla's requesting a loan to buy merchandise, red snapper to continue with her sales and her profits.

She makes the effort to get her children ahead.  She has worked for 12 years in this job.  Previously she was a student.

She's very satisfied because it has helped her improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.ru: Комилджону 29 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Комилджон более 2 года занимается услугой такси. Комилджон очень любит свою работу и старается преподнести услугу таксиста на высшем уровне. Он имеет своих постоянных клиентов и получает ежедневный доход. Он тратит все свои деньги для обеспечения детей и жены. Недавно его брат обратился ему за деньгами, так как он хочет уехать за рубежом, целью найти подходящую работу. Он не имеет постоянную работу на родине. Комилджон обратился за займом, чтобы помочь брату. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Komiljon is 29 years old. He is married and raising three children. Komiljon has provided a taxi service for more than two years. Komiljon loves his work very much, and tries to present a taxi service of the highest level. He has returning customers and receives a daily income. He spends all his money on supporting his children and wife. 

Not long ago his brother turned to him for money, as he would like to travel abroad, with an aim to find suitable work. He does not have permanent work in his home country. Komiljon turned for a loan in order to help his brother. He requests a loan in the amount of 500 US dollar for the purchase of flight tickets. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy a plane ticket for his brother who wants to go abroad for work

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane lives in the Mombasa area of Coast Province, Kenya. She is a single mother of one school-going child. Jane owns a food stall, a business which she has been operating for three years, and mainly deals in the sale of vegetables. This is her only source of income currently.

Jane learnt about Milango through friends who invited her to the group. She joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve her business operations. Jane is applying for a loan of 36,650 Kenyan shillings to buy food stock like fruits and vegetables for sale. She will use the extra income from the loan to improve the living standards of her family – especially education.

loans.use: To buy food stock like fruits and vegetables for sale.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony lives in the Kilifi area of Coast Province, Kenya. He is a single businessman who owns a retail shop, a business which he has been running for two years. In this business, he sells retail items such as rice, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc. 

He learned about Milango through friends who invited him to the group. He joined with the aim of accessing credit to improve his business operations. His main challenge is inflation. Anthony is applying for a loan of 41,900 KES to buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc. The extra income from the loan will be added to his savings to improve his living standard.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar, flour, etc.
